campaign.story:
**A QUICK NOTE**
We are not oblivious to the craziness going on in our world right now due to COVID-19. One thing we'll be doing for this campaign is giving out chapters 1 and 2 (digital) of this graphic novel for FREE to all backers NOW to keep you engaged until the FULL graphic novel is complete and shipped to you.
Also, at the $50 tier, we're offering a buy one give one option where you get two signed copies of Iyanu - Child of Wonder graphic novel PLUS a bonus comic. You get to keep your copy (plus the bonus comic) and donate/gift the other copy to someone. 
Please scroll to the Why Is This Important section for more details on this and more. 
Looking For Stretch Goals?
Scroll down towards the end of the page ;)
Iyanu chronicles the journey of a teenage orphan girl with no recollection of her past, who suddenly discovers that she has abilities that rival the ancient deities of her people. It is these abilities that are the key to bringing back the age of wonders and saving a world on the brink of destruction at the hands of The Corrupt — Cursed Wildlife and Divine Beasts desperate to destroy humanity.
Volume 1 of the graphic novel (offered in this Kickstarter) is 112 pages.
For as long as I can remember, I've loved kids & family fantasy/adventure stories. I grew up watching amazing animated films/TV series and was always blown away by their fantastic storytelling. But three particular stories will always have a special place in my heart: Avatar: The Last Airbender, Brave and The Incredibles.
The Iyanu: Child of Wonder Graphic Novel Series follows in the same footsteps as the aforementioned epic stories. It's fun and heartwarming family entertainment that features a young protagonist who embarks on an adventure that is exciting, unpredictable, and full of magic.
It is on this very journey that our lovable protagonist (Iyanu) truly discovers herself and learns the real meaning of being a hero. However, there is one distinctive quality this project has, which the previously mentioned projects do not — the lore of African culture and mythology as told from the point of view of an African writer.
SYNOPSIS
It has been over a thousand years since the age of wonders — a time where the Divine Ones blessed humanity with spiritual, structural, and technological marvels.
But in the blink of an eye, it all vanished, and all that was left were remnants of an ancient, advanced civilization. As humankind forges ahead, culture becomes knowledge, knowledge becomes history, and history becomes mythology. Until Iyanu. A teenage orphan girl with no recollection of her past who suddenly discovers that she has hidden powers that rival the Divine Ones themselves.
As Iyanu tries to come to terms with her new abilities, the people of Yorubaland become aware of an ancient evil that has reawakened. And all that's left between them and destruction are the memories locked away in the mind of Iyanu.
I created Iyanu for everyone and anyone (kids, teenagers, adults, and families) who loves a great fantasy/adventure coming of age story.
Similar to Disney/Pixar's Brave and Netflix's The Dragon Prince, Iyanu does not shy away from the use of epic, fantastical elements (magic, mythical beast, angels, etc.) to shape its story and characters. But on a deeper level, these elements are used to illustrate one central truth — light always overcoming darkness.
The series will explore several themes children and adults alike can relate to and be inspired by. Forgiveness, fellowship, community, acceptance will be central to the story. But ultimately, the goal is to have the audience leave with a feeling that there is greatness within each of us, and we must use this greatness to make our world a better place, just like Iyanu.
Iyanu: Child of Wonder showcases the majesty and awe that is ancient West Africa. Costumes, character designs, set pieces, artifacts, humor, etc. all serve to highlight a robust diversity of culture and tradition like never before. Below are some of the key aspects of the world that make it unique. Many of which are actually inspired by Yoruba culture of the medieval era.
If there's anything that we've learned about the entertainment industry in the last few years, it's that the demand for content featuring African culture is huge, and yet, grossly under-served, especially as it pertains to young black girls.
We hope to change this starting with Iyanu!
COMICS & COVID-19
We are not oblivious to the craziness going on in our world right now due to COVID-19. While there were many reasons we very seriously considered suspending this Kickstarter campaign, we made the challenging decision to move forward for many other reasons - the three primary reasons being:
1. Our devotion towards our mission - To create African inspired superhero and fantasy stories for a global audience. Stories that Entertain, Educate, and Inspire!
2. To offer, in our own tiny way, a sense of normalcy in these very stressful times to our community of readers, fans and supporters. With events shutting down all over, routines being abruptly altered, and with families being cooped up at home; coming together as a community (in any way we can safely do so) is more important than ever. And that's what Kickstarter and projects like these are all about.
3.  To be honest, being an independent creator/artist can be brutal at times. Especially concerning finances. Ask any creator, and most will tell you that one or two consecutive bad months could mean "game over" for their business. At YouNeek Studios, we pay our artists directly from the revenue from book sales. But, we use Kickstarter as a means to raise money to print said books.
That being said, we believe some good can come out of this. Which is why we've decided that with this campaign, we'll be giving out chapters 1 and 2 (digital) of this graphic novel for FREE to all backers PLUS a FREE quarantine bundle (digital) of some of our previous comics to EVERY backer as soon as we get funded!
COMICS YOU GET AS SOON AS WE GET FUNDED (DIGITAL)
E.X.O. – The Legend of Wale Williams Vol 1 (156 pages)
Malika – Warrior Queen Vol 1 (144 pages)
Iyanu: Child of Wonder Chp 1 & 2 (60 pages)
Training Courses/Tutorials (how to start your own creative business)

NOTE** 
Two options: 1) We send you the books and you can decide who you want to give them to. 2) We'll donate the second book on your behalf to someone who can't afford to buy it right now.
Now more than ever, it's important we spread the LOVE. 


The book is 90% complete! YouNeek Studios pays the artists directly (using non-Kickstarter funded money) to complete the books BEFORE launching any of our Kickstarters. All the money received from Kickstarter goes towards printing, creating the rewards (t-shirts, toys, etc.), and Kickstarter fees. 
Check out the chart below for a full breakdown.




Iyanu
Iyanu's story begins after she is found wandering in the forest region of Elu, the last walled city in Yorubaland, as a child with her eyes glowing bright blue. Having no recollection of her past, Olori, the last surviving member of the Agoni — A group of priests who are the "Carriers of History" — takes her on as an apprentice.
After training Iyanu both in the art of combat and the history of Yorubaland for five years, Iyanu does the forbidden and ventures into the inner walls of Elu. A place none of the Agoni are permitted to venture into. After being spotted by guards, Iyanu sprints away to safety. However, the emotional stress of the entire experience causes Iyanu's hidden powers to manifest in the forest. An event that changes everything!
Yorubaland
Yorubaland is the cultural region of the Yoruba people in West Africa.
Elu
Elu is the only walled settlement in all of Yorubaland with walls strong and high enough to keep out The Corrupt. Elu is also home to Iyanu. Who along with Olori, lives in the Forest District.
The Oba
The Oba is the sitting king of Elu. When an Oba dies, an Aremo (heir) is selected from a pool of heirs by the Elu Mesi.
Elu Mesi - The Council
The council acts as advisors to the Oba. They are there to keep his power in check. Behind the scenes, they can wield absolute power if an Oba is weak. The Elu Mesi is made up of seven elders.
Nuro (Basorun)
Nuro is the Chancellor and Basorun (head of the council) of the Elu Mesi. Some say he skipped the selection ritual after the previous Oba passed away, choosing instead to install a puppet king. A devious ploy that would make him the most powerful man in Elu.
The Agoni
The Agoni are a group of priests who are referred to as the "Carriers of History." For centuries, they played a crucial spiritual role in Elu and made many discoveries by harnessing visions in The Temple of the Forgotten. However, in recent years, they were all but wiped out by order of Basorun in what he claimed was: "The Agoni Rebellion."
Olori
Olori is the last of the Agoni. She took Iyanu in as an apprentice after she found her wandering in the forest with no memory. This sage and capable priestess has many secrets - some of which negatively impact Iyanu's destiny.
The Eso
The Eso are the elite military men and women of Elu. They are the only ones permitted to venture outside the walls. They are lead by the Eso of Esos: Kakanfo.
The Corrupt
After the curse a thousand years ago, these animals have become exponentially more aggressive. They now seek to kill humans at all costs.
Roye Okupe - Writer/Creator/Art Director
Born in Lagos, Nigeria, Roye Okupe is an award-winning filmmaker, author, speaker and entrepreneur whose passion for comics and animation led him to found YouNeek Studios in 2012, an avenue that would allow him to pursue his dream of creating a diverse library of superheroes. Under that umbrella, Roye wrote, produced and directed several animated productions including, but not limited to, the award-winning and critically acclaimed Malika – Warrior Queen Animated Short. These productions have allowed Roye to attain many prestigious recognitions, such as being #5 on Ventures Africa's list of 40 African innovators to watch (2016) as well as being part of NewAfrican Magazines' 100 most influential Africans two years in a row (2016 & 2017).
With the superhero genre currently at the height of popularity, Roye has made it a goal to create a connected universe of heroes, with origins from locations that are currently neglected and/or ignored. In August 2015, Roye released his debut graphic novel titled: E.X.O. The Legend of Wale Williams Part One, a superhero story set in a futuristic Nigeria. E.X.O. was received with critical acclaim and has since been featured on CNN, Forbes, The New York Times, NBC, The Guardian, ABC7, BBC, The Huffington Post, Mashabe and more! Roye's sophomore graphic novel: Malika – Warrior Queen was also received with critical acclaim, selling more than 40,000 copies of its chapter one special during Diamond Comic's Free Comic Book Day (2017). Both books have gone on to win several awards, including multiple Glyph Comic Awards and Comic Fist Awards
Godwin Akpan - Illustrator
Godwin discovered the digital canvas in the early days of the computer revolution in Nigeria. Having trained as a traditional artist in college, Godwin brings his unique set of skills into creating digital masterpieces. His character design works have been featured in major digital art forums worldwide. He also lectures digital art in masterclasses with the comic panel academy.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having run 7 successful Kickstarter (and delivering all rewards to all backers) before, I am fully confident and also very well prepared to run this Kickstarter smoothly. However, should any issues arise, I plan on handling them in a professional manner. I will also be sending frequent messages via the Kickstarter updates thread to keep everyone informed on progress. I believe in 100% transparency and you guys deserve nothing less.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
What is P.B.Soldier?
P.B.Soldier is a science fiction adventure that follows covert operative Nat Cummings, a skilled computer hacker using his skills to help pay for college tuition when his activities are discovered and he becomes listed as an International Terror Threat - code red. The newly formed government/paramilitary organization called The Establishment, gives him a simple choice, either work with them to become a highly-trained assassin or be terminated. 
Cummings, a sniper class operative specializing in hacking, hand-to-hand combat, blade combat and stealth, is exceptional at his job. Until the day he meets Jazen, a mark and former E-Operative who knows more about him and “The E” than he does. Nat is confronted with the stunning realization that his work might not be for the greater good. Now he’s on a quest to learn the truth while coding an elaborate program to divest himself from The Establishment before becoming its next target.
P.B.Soldier’s premise is The Bourne Identity meets V for Vendetta as Cummings becomes a double-agent of sorts trying to bring down a system from the inside without letting those he cares about fall into harm's way.
The goal of the Kickstarter is to raise $10,000 for the production of P.B. Soldier's first graphic novel "The Awakening". It is a 170 page collected edition of the first 7 issues of the P.B. Soldier storyline. Funds will go towards payment to line artist and colorist Abel Garcia and actual production of the book, including printing and distribution. In addition, some of the proceeds are being donated to the Malcolm X Shabazz High School Gerald Lawson’s Video Game and App Development Academy in Newark, NJ. - a program that Gifted has developed and led for the past 2 years. 

 P.B.SOLDIER VOL. 1 - "THE AWAKENING" GRAPHIC NOVEL
Written by: Naseed Gifted; Artist: Abel Garcia
INCLUDED IN THE COLLECTED EDITION ARE THE FIRST 10 PAGES OF JAZEN'S STANDALONE STORY!
Who are the characters?
COMICS 
Digital Edition of P.B.Soldier: Vol. 1 "The Awakening"
170 page PRINT Editions of P.B.Soldier: Vol. 1 "The Awakening"
SOFTCOVER EDITION
SPECIAL HARDCOVER EDITION  
BY ARTIST ABEL GARCIA 
 HARDCOVER EDITION
  170-page Print SPECIAL EDITION HARDCOVER by artist MSHINDO KUUMBA
 HARDCOVER SPECIAL EDITION

POSTERS
P.B. Soldier World Poster
P.B.Soldier Cover "Poster Pack"


APPAREL
 P.B.SOLDIER NATHANIEL CUMMINGS COSPLAY SUIT AND WEAPONS
  P.B.Soldier Unisex Logo T-Shirt
 Khemfest 2020 Drawstring Bag
Custom P.B.Soldier Sunglasses 
Naseed Gifted of PBS Media Using Comics to Teach S.T.E.M. at Steven Institute of Technology
$10,000
A monetary donation will be made to Malcolm X Shabazz High School - Gerald Lawson's Video Game / App Development Academy.
$15,000
We can distribute STEM curriculum sets to schools in Newark, NJ.
$20,000
We can produce the next Episode 4.0 & 4.5. This Episode is Part 1 & Part 2 of "Battle With The Beast Within" story. 
$25,000
Development of Episode 5.0 & 5.5 will be produced. (We can also deliver 4.0 and 4.5 to you faster!)
$30,000
Development of Episode 6.0 & 6.5 will be produced. (We can also deliver 5.0 and 5.5 to you faster!)
$35,000
A full P.B.Soldier T-shirt line for Men, Women and Children featuring characters and setting from the P.B.Soldier storyline.
$65,000
Development of P.B.Soldier Animated plot. (The script is ready and the Animation Studios has been selected.)
_______________________________________________________
ABOUT THE CREATORS
Naseed Gifted
Naseed Gifted, GLYPH Award Winning Writer and Creator of P.B.Soldier
Naseed Gifted is a two-time Glyph Comic Awards and Urban Action Showcase nominee, an educator, engineer and writer. A New Jersey native, he is also a graduate of the New Jersey Institute of Technology. His childhood obsession with comics rarely portrayed heroes that resembled him which fueled his desire to inject more diversity in the world of comic books. His mission in his graphic expression is to encompass a distinct balance between unprecedented storytelling and exceptional artwork. He is also the founder of New Jersey’s Black Comic Book Festival “Khem Fest” and travels across the country as a panelist for Full Spectrum: Why Color in Comics Matters and Using Comics to teach STEM. Published works include self-published sci-fi comic book series: P.B.Soldier & Jazen; Short stories: Occupy Renaissance City and Terrorist Act of 2011; and Director/Writer: P.B.Soldier “The Awakening” Short Film and P.B.Soldier Animated Short.

Abel Garcia
Abel Garcia, GLYPH Award Winning Artist of P.B.Soldier

Abel Garcia hails from Barcelona, Spain. He has been the artist on the entire P.B.Soldier series and will be collaborating with writer/creator Naseed Gifted for "The Awakening". From an early age, Garcia liked to draw. As a youth, he studied illustration and animation at various art schools in Barcelona, Spain. His work can be seen in the comics Bad Puppy and Nancy in Hell published by Image Comics (USA) and Drums, #2, 3 and 4, published by Image Comics (USA) and Dibbuks Editorial (Spain). Today, Garcia lends his talent to numerous comics, with various themes, enjoyed in many different parts of the world. He now resides in Mollet del Valles, Barcelona, with his wife, daughter and cat.
THANK YOU!
First off we want to thank everyone who has supported P.B.Soldier project thus far. We can’t put into words how inspiring it is to us to see your ongoing support. It has kept our dreams alive and allowed us to get to this point - the completion of our long anticipated "The Awakening" graphic novel is ready for the presses.
I would like to thank special individuals that keep my fire burning. First the Creator and the Ancestors for allowing me to persevere through the good and tough times, my children (Bakari and Layla) for tagging along with me on this journey and inspiring to develop a Legacy for our family, to my Queen Auset Cureton thank you all of the years of love and support and assisting me into getting to this point, The PBS Media Team (Khaaz, Dilettante, Abel and Manoli) because the best is yet to come,  Kurt Langevine of ThreeKeys Productions a star in his own right, Brother Mshindo, Manuel Godroy, Adewunmi Roye, Yumy Odom, Akinseye Brown, Taylor Sterling and Tim Fielder your work has inspired to stay phocused and pushing harder, Tiyland Consulting for helping us get to this point without your assistance this would not be possible, my Malcolm X Shabazz High School family & Central High School (Staff and Students), my family and friends for the constant support and love you show even when cards are not in our favor and my mother and father for giving me the opportunity to walk this Earth and make a difference.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With all creative projects, there is a chance of delay before presenting a final product. The date of delivery of all backer rewards is an estimated date that hinges on printing. We'll make sure to keep all backers updated on the progress of this project and any delays as they arise. Remember Stay Phocused.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: 10 Reasons to use Graphic Novels to help your Reluctant/ Advanced Reader
updates.update_content:
Peace and Blessings Family:

 This year has been a year of change with challenges that we've never experienced. 

 We just wanted to take the time out to thank you and say that we appreciate you for your commitment to impact the community and family. 

 Your continuous efforts to make a difference particularly during these difficult times does not go unrecognized. 

 We are here and would love to support and assist you with your goals and empower the community. 

 Wishing you continued success. 

 Stay safe and well.

 Best,

Peace and Blessings P.B.Soldier Family: 
I hope all is well. I wanted to extend an invitation to all of you for our Book Launch.  Without your support we would not be able to make it to this point. I would love to meet all of you in person.
Are you Awake?

Peace and Blessings P.B.Soldier Family:
We want to take the opportunity to thank you once again for JOINing THE MOVEMENT and partaking in this journey. All rewards are being sent this week. We are super exciting to bring this project to life and hope it meets all of your expectations. We will continue to keep in touch with you and would like for you be apart of the launch for the graphic novel to the general public on September 20.2020. As a backer you have the honor and privilege of receiving these items two months before everyone else. Enjoy and let us know what you think.

The wait is finally over. We are Proud to say The Awakening has arrived and we can not wait to get it in your hands. All backers will receive their rewards beginning this week. We would like to thank you again for your patience and constant support.
Remember to Stay Phocused and Always Resist. #PBSoldier
Big reveal of the P.B.Soldier graphic novel launching 9.20.20

Peace and Blessings P.B.Soldier Family!!
We just wanted to touch based with everyone during these chaotic times. We are facing a pandemic and a civil rights movement all at the same time. We wanted to make you aware that the P.B.Soldier Team is staying safe and we stand against systematic racism.  

Quick Update on the Kickstarter the physical books are being printed and P.B.Soldier The Awakening looks good! We have a few more tweaks to make and we'll begin shipping out rewards. Looks like that will happen by the end of July.

updates.update_userinfo: Thank you for Joining the Movement!!!
updates.update_content:
Hello Family:
I hope everyone is staying safe and doing well so far. Things are changing so rapidly from day to day, and weather you're stuck at home or working on the front line. I salute you continue to remain safe and take time for yourself so you don’t become stare crazy. 
I want to give you an update we are currently finalizing the final pages of the graphic novel and completed the Hacker’s Guide to P.B.Soldier (Activity Packet) that we are going give to all of the backers dor FREE. Here’s a sneak peek of the cover and pages included.

Peace and Blessings Everyone,
I just want to get a wellness check with all of you. I know we are experiencing emotional trauma in isolation as we deal with COVID-19. I want to remind everyone to keep your heads high as we are going to get through this together. Stay Phocused. Stay Strong. Stay Safe. Stay Well. Stay Creative AF! Let me know how you are doing. Looking forward to hearing from you.
Thank you, Thank you, Thank you!!!
Thank you, Thank you, Thank you!!!

campaign.story: Hi, I’m Cap Santiago and this is my Kickstarter Campaign. Through the many years I have been involved in the cosplay community, I have been blessed with the opportunity to be part of some amazing projects such as Men vs. Cosplay Calendar, Rescuemen USA  and being on the COVER of NOVA #1 from Marvel Comics. For years, many people have often asked why have I not done my own calendar yet . Well the wait is over… I am here to announce that I am finally doing my own 2020 calendar!!! In order for this to happen I will need your help…FUNDING! All the monies raised here will go into designing, printing and shipping the calendar out to you later this year. I have been working hard with various photographers and stylists on new photos you have never seen me do before. It’s been exciting and creative! I think you are going to truly love my new work! ,the photos are done and being edited as we speak. I have tried to keep costs down so I could make this affordable for everyone. I am offering a digital version of the calendar , a physical hard copy and We have several tiers for the calendar which will include one or all of the postcard sets which are very special pictures not included in the calendar. These include the cosplay set (some really cool things), Desiree Dear set (My drag persona, corseted up and in some sexy heels for you!), and Cap got nudes set (this one speaks for itself). You won’t find these pictures anywhere else.They are all new just for you! We have thirty days to get to our goal. If we meet the goal before thirty days I do have a secret reward in mind for the calendar.Thank you for considering this and I hope to be sending you one of these rewards soon.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The photos are done and being edited as we speak , for me I believe that was the hard part.

updates.update_content: Good evening everyone , there was some slight difficulties with the Digital photos for the Calendar. I spoke to a representative  of Dropbox and they helped me resolve the problem with the images of October ans November, Now you can properly download those two months . I am sorry for for any inconvenience it may have caused you . Have a good night

The Calendars and post cards are here , I will be shipping everyone's reward asap. Just make sure if you haven't yet please provide your address , your birthday if you ordered the Birthday gift set and one of the three post cards sets if you ordered 3 on 3 , Silver Lining , and Impeccable Taste. Thank you for your patience and Happy Thanksgiving everyone.

Good evening everyone , I am terribly sorry for no recent updates.There is no excuse for my actions , since the last update I made a rookie mistake with the dimensions of the calendar and how the Cover photo is suppose to fit on the page.After trying to salvage the cover image me and my team determined we would have to start the Calendar cover again from scratch.I am proud to say it is finished and you might like the new cover even more .
 Also I have messaged a few of you requesting how you would like your name in the calendar if you purchased the 35.00 and 40.00 reward.Please get back to me as soon as possible in your convenience. Oh and one more thing.Please email me your address so I can ship your 2020 'Cap"alendar with the extra swag you got. Thank you for your time

updates.update_userinfo: From the bottom of my heart
updates.update_content: Wow I must say your support knows no bounds I am honored you all pledge to my creation.You believed in me and my ambition and for that there is no greater reward for me than to have your gracious support ,wisdom, words of encouragement .Thank you all again and I promise you will get your monies worth and then some.I love you all

Looks like we are sold out of The Birthday Gift but there are plenty of other rewards left.So tell your friends , co workers , etc.Meanwhile in the Bat cave I am hard at work figuring out who is going to represent what month,

If you saw Pete's Basement last Thusday on Facebook live I revealed the Calendar cover .In case you didn't get a chance to see it here is the cover for the Calendar. were reached our goal but there is still some rewards available.Please share with anyone or a group page you think might be interested , and also thank you all for believing in me and my Calendar. I promise you wont be disappointed.

This past Thursday I was given the privilege to to be a guest on Pete's Basement show . We talked about comics , cosplay , self love , and of course The "Cap"alendar where I revealed exclusively the cover for the calendar. Check it out https://www.facebook.com/petesbasement/videos/412644819386775/

updates.update_userinfo: Having a Drag of a time
updates.update_content: I have been cosplaying since 2005 , I have had a blast but one day I decided I wanted to challenge myself but how.The answer came to me in the form of a good friend of mine who suggested I should try Drag.After some heavy thought I decided this was how I would challenge myself but I had to learn the art of doing Drag. My good friend/Drag Mom Doris Dear(FB @AmericasPerfectHousewife) took me under her beautiful wing and taught me the history and what it means to do be a Drag Queen.

updates.update_userinfo: The most challenging cosplay in the project
updates.update_content: We have come so far since last Thursday,I want to thank everyone that has helped funded this calendar so far.we still have a journey ahead of us but we're almost there .I wanted to share with you what I think was my most challenging costume for the calendar ,Kratos God Of War .

campaign.story:
Witness the birth of the Konkret Universe. This is the first collective release from Konkret Comics. Over the skies of Sapphire City, Demetri Price, known as Akolyte is a beacon of hope. Absolver, the Wraith of Vengeance prowls the gloomy streets of Caesar City. Odina Troussard, known simply as Odina, looks to escape her past in the bustling metropolis of Atlanta, GA. Justice calls Las Sombras- The City of Shadows, his earthly home. Konkret Comics brings you four tales of action, adventure, and mystery. Join us as we enter a universe unlike any you’ve ever seen before.
First and Foremost, Konkret Comics is committed to excellence and storytelling. As such, the campaign is a “pre-order” platform. Konkret Comics will deliver these highly anticipated stories to our supporters regardless of circumstance. The campaign itself is an effort by our company to cut down production/shipping and issue fulfillment time. You have been with us every step of the way, now join us as we make our dreams come true.


The Issues

Akolyte
Akolyte Issue #1: Son of a Supreme- 24 full pages (all ages)
     In a galaxy far from his own, Demetri Price finds himself face to face with destiny. He must accept his legacy and embrace a power he never knew, in order to protect the people he loves. Does Demetri have the courage to become The Akolyte, Guardian of the Cosmos?

Odina Issue 1 " Omni Strike"
Odina Issue #1: Omni Strike- 27 full pages (all ages)
     Written by Onaji Rouse, we find our titular heroine and her Omni Strike team facing Felix Rowe, a man whose powers have grown exponentially. With the fires of their battle barely cooled, Odina and her team learn that Felix Rowe is just the tip of a deepening mystery. Can Odina trust the mysterious stranger with one too many answers? And who is the enigmatic and deadly Lady Tiye?

Absolver Issue 1 " Arrival"
Absolver Issue #1: Arrival- 22 full pages (some mature content)
     Appearing on the gloomy streets of Caesar City, the wraith known as Absolver returns with no memory of his past. With his guide Lea, Absolver will learn his purpose. But he is not the only thing that returned. Something far more sinister has made its way passed the gates of Hell. As their fates collide, is Caesar City ready for the wraith of vengeance?
Justice "Zero Issue" Parley
Justice Issue #0: Parlay- 10 full pages (all ages)
     The angel known as Justice has left Paradise and descended through the Firmament. Landing on Earth, he seeks out the only person he knows… Morning Star. As the world races deeper into darkness two age-old adversaries draw battle lines. But has Justice stumbled into a larger game, one he can’t hope to win against the one creative perfect in beauty and wisdom?

  Contributors
Derek Allen
Derek Allen- Creator/Writer/Letterer (Akolyte)
    Born in Philadelphia, PA Derek had no lack of inspiration. Starting at home with his parents, who encouraged his imagination to flourish, he was also able to look at iconic Philly personalities for encouragement. As a creator, he’s always thought that good storytelling never goes out of style. With Akolyte, he hopes to inspire any little girl or boy that dreams of doing something extraordinary.
  Brian "Bats" Lambert
Brian "Bats" J. Lambert- Creator/Writer (Justice)
    A native of San Pedro, CA, currently living in Las Vegas, NV, Brian fell in love with Frank Miller’s writing style the first time he read the Dark Knight returns. Miller’s influence, as well as that of Alan Moore and Neil Gaiman, among others, is evident in the way he crafts his narratives. Justice is a book that shows you have everything in you to be great, you just have to take that leap of faith.
  Onaji Rouse
Onaji Rouse- Creator/Writer (Odina)
    Hailing from the Mecca of African-American entertainment, Atlanta, GA, Onaji has always wanted to create worlds and stories for his people. He credits both Stan Lee and Dwayne McDuffie for paving the way for him. Jim Lee’s iconic run on X-Men also had a heavy influence on his style and desire to write comics. Odina embodies the strength in all of us and the willingness to work through the difficult times in our past in order to make a difference in the future.
  Jermael Lessey
Jermael Lessey- Creator/Writer (Absolver)
    Jermael was able to cultivate multiple sources of inspiration, having been born in Trinidad and Tobago and raised in both New York and Florida. The Christopher Reeve Superman and 1989 Batman ignited the fire within him, but Spawn set it ablaze. Through Absolver, Jermael wants to create a space where African-Americans can experience a mythos that represents them.
 
Artist, Colorist & Letterers

Bruno Lima- Lead Artist (Covers) (Akolyte)
    Bruno has been a comic illustrator since 2014. The rhythm and culture of his hometown of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil translates through his art. When not drawing, Bruno likes to gain inspiration from walking in nature. The Dark Knight and Watchmen were very influential on his career and the strong lines and definitive strokes of his art are a testament to that.
  Hakan Aydin- Illustrator (Absolver/Justice)
    From his hometown in Turkey, Hakan brings his signature illustration style to the Konkret Universe. Tackling multiple titles, he uses his 8 years of experience to convey the multiple tones and expressions of the characters. In his free time, Hakan likes to swim, is an avid movie-goer and plays videogames.
  Eric Souza (Blake)- Illustrator (Odina)
    Spiraling out of his love of X-Men, Wolverine, and Hellboy, Eric became an illustrator in his hometown of Belem do Para, Brazil. He draws inspiration from what he sees around him. Whether it’s the artistry he sees while he’s cooking or the colors and composition he sees while walking, Eric enjoys all forms of art. While not bringing his skills to numbered pages, he is also a video producer.
  Opi Hidayat- Illustrator (Akolyte)
    Opi’s early interest in illustration came from his love of Dragonball and anime. He studied graphic design in his home country of Indonesia and became a freelance illustrator in 2014. He works mostly international and has been able to use various different styles from countries around the world. Not only a comic illustrator, Opi also dabbles in video game design and development.
  Nestor Redulla- Colorist (Justice)
    Nestor brings his vivid and dynamic color style to the pages of Justice, all the way from the Philippines. He’s been in comics professionally for 5 years and enjoys Deadpool, The Hulk and anything Spider-Man related. When not making amazing looking pages, he spends his time powerlifting.
  Adalberto Menezes- Colorist (Odina)
    Adalberto is a fan of Watchmen, and Frank Miller’s work on Sin City, 300 and The Dark Knight. His influences shine through as he brings the illustrations on Odina to life with dramatic flair. In between coloring pages, Adalberto practices capoeira, origami and reads books in Belem do Para.
  Bryan Arfel Magnaye- Colorist (Absolver)
    Bryan is from Batangas City in the Philippines and considers Spawn one of his greatest inspirations. It is no wonder then, that his work on Absolver translates that dark/gothic style. Bryan enjoys watching movies and playing basketball when not bringing his talents to the pages of comic books.
  Michael Woods- Colorist (Akolyte)
    Michael has been coloring comic books for about 4 years, having migrated from Japanese manga to the American market. He finds his inspiration in all things, from life to art, and anything else that catches his eye. Not solely a colorist, Michael is also an ambitious artist as well.
  Matheus Huve- Colorist (Akolyte)
    Matheus has been a comic enthusiast as long as he can remember. He began professionally coloring comics in 2017, having previously worked on his own projects. His coloring style is diverse but influenced by Ivan Nunes, Elizabeth Breitweiser, and Mat Lopes among others. Matheus is a huge fan of Pop Culture and loves horror and science fiction.
  Rodney Jean-Etienne- Letterer (Odina)
    Rodney brings his lettering style from Corona, NY to the pages of Odina. His favorite comic series is the Legend of Will Power.
  Rune Makerz- Letterer (Justice)
    Rune Makerz is a collection of graphic artists from the West Coast. They bring their signature style to the pages of Justice.

On behalf of the Konkret Comics family, we thank you for your love, your support, and most of all your patients. With that being said, your digital rewards have officially been released and are available for your consumption. So pull out your sledge hammer, break the seal, and dive into the Konkret Universe with these awesome books. #KeepItKonkret
P.S. Let us know what you think. We would love to hear your feedback.

campaign.story:
From the mind of famed author Roosevelt Pitt, Jr. 
AN ECBACC GYLPH AWARD WINNER!
Comes a story of epic proportions
Jamil Khalid, eleven-year-old genius pilots Dynamo Azaan a mech powered by the gods of Africa, to protect a city whose existence ensures the survival of humanity.
The Place: Kenya, Africa where lies the most highly technological city known to man. Hermopolis!!!
A haven of spiritual enchantment fueled by the African gods of old, Hermopolis is revered as the Utopia of the modern age of man. 
It’s here that lives are forever changed and discoveries are born. But where gold sparkles there are those who lie in wait to covet it. And then there are those who seek to control it at any cost.
Enter the world of Dynamo Azaan Dreamer, Adventurer, Hero, and the most powerful mech on the planet. 
Piloted by his ten year old creator Jamil Khalid, Dynamo embarks on a quest of self discovery as he faces threats that could tear his beloved city asunder.
Jamil Khalid ten year old genius, designer of Dynamo Azaan
Jamil's bio fusion suit! Equipped with an advanced state of the art visual components, stealth capabilities, limited flight and defensive weaponry.
 It’s time to get your mech on and be part of a project that will change the landscape of children’s entertainment. We ask your support to help produce the Dynamo Azaan graphic novel and receive a plethora of incentives such as…free copies of the graphic novel, t-shirts, original signed art or a special guest pass to our debut of  
The Main Mech: DYNAMO AZAAN!!! 
At 50 Feet tall Dynamo Azaan has the powers of Flight, solar shields, Bio Kenietic eye beams, Energy containment/entrapment fields and an assortment of visual capabilities and other offensive weapons.
Dynamo Azaan was built as the sole protector of the beloved city Hemopolis!
As the worlds first Bio-sentient Robot or Bio-Synthedroid Dynamo Azaan is equipped with tri-dimensional cerebral unit or T.D.C.U. A highly advanced electronic brain that simulates the synapses functions of a human brain and houses experiences for future recall. 
A Revolving Cockpit for Jamil that can detach and converted into a land to air vehicle.
NOW LETS MEET SOME OF THE GOOD GUYS:
Young Jamil may have invented and designed Dynamo Azaan, but his father Dr. Yassir Khalid built him!
 His greatest achievement and greatest secret is the Tri-Dimensional Cerebral Unit, the device the powers the huge robot.
Dr. Yassir Khalid father of Jamil is the worlds foremost expert in bionics and robotics. He is also the builder of Dynam Azaan and founder of Khalid Industries.
Special Agent Shelia Danhurst
One of the top field agents of the FBI it takes a lot to make her nervous. When it happens, she calls Dynamo Azaan!
Assigned to lead the federal division of Para-human and alien affairs, Sheila often finds herself pitted against untold horros!
CARMEN SUNG
The only student who’s come close to challenging Jamil in the academic arena, Carmen Sung loves competition. 
Sometimes wisecracking, but down to earth and practical, Carmen helps Jamil see the bigger picture in most situations.
 Chief Nwankwo
Tough as nails and a pure believer of "going by the book", Chief Achojah Nwankwo will use every means at his disposal including his special tactical unit the Last R.E.S.O.R.T.
An old fashioned cop in a new wave city
Oshun 
The Orishna goddess of love and creation and the mother of Jamil Khalid.  She is also referred to as the queen of the witches: She is a teacher of both magic and mysticism. 
Oshun loves casting spells, especially those related to romance and seduction. She is the granter of wishes and all of your heart’s desires.
NOW LETS MEET SOME OF THE BAD GUYS!
BOOOOO!!!!
Dr. Cryptic
A lover of cryptic messages and a master of genetic engineering, Dr. Francis Stewart known as Dr. Cryptic plans to bring back the prehistoric age no matter the cost. 
Dr. Cryptic!
Madam Matrix
Sylvia Colter is the mistress of cyberspace and owner of the worldwide internet conglomerate Uninet.   Sylvia Colter is also the ominous Madam Matrix.   
Madam Matrix!
Atomic Sam    
Atomic Sam has the power of atomic fusion and can increase his mass for short periods of time as well as generate atomic blasts at will.    
Atomic Sam!
Why Kickstarter?
Making comics is a long and often expensive process. Our goal is to bring you a complete story featuring Dynamo Azaan that will show his world..
Dynamo Azaan Graphic Novel!
NOW LET'S TAKE A LOOK AT THE INTERIOR PAGES!!!
PAGE 1
 Talk about an epic start!
PAGE 2
PAGE 3
CHECK OUT THESE LAYOUTS BY NATS LEDESMA!

Just 15% away!  Continue to share and pledge if you can.  Click here>>> http://bit.ly/PurgeBlackout2

updates.update_userinfo: WE NEED YOUR HELP! 17 DAYS LEFT TO MAKE PURGE BLACKOUT DOUBLE IMPACT HAPPEN1
updates.update_content: 17 Days left to take us over the top! Who will help us cross the $4 grand mark this weekend? Your support as always is appreciated. Continue to share and pledge!

We have decided to give our previous backers first dibs!
So we launched a day early just for you guys!
Your loyalty and patience is greatly appreciated and its because of you that we are still doing our best to provide quality content featuring African American heroes.
We thank you!

I'm thrilled to announce that the Purge Blackout campaign will be launched Monday September 23rd! I ask that all of my supporters take a sneak peak at the campaign to be ready to snag your copies and take advantage of the early bird specials shown below! I think you will like we have in store! Click the link below! http://bit.ly/PurgeBlackout2

updates.update_userinfo: It's Finally Happening! PURGE AND BLACKOUT ISSUES 2 ARE COMING!
updates.update_content: For my supporter of Dynamo Azaan.  These are the ones you've been waiting for! Purge  and Blackout Issues 2! September 2019! Be Ready! Covers by Netho Diaz and Mshindo Kuumba

Unfortunately we didn't make goal, but that is not the end,  Dynamo will be back.  Until then look forward to our next campaign announcement.  You will be the first to find out here!  Thanks again to everyone!

updates.update_userinfo: TWO WEEKS LEFT TO GO! LET'S MAKE IT HAPPEN!
updates.update_content: Anyone will tell you that launching a crowdfunding campaign and seeing it through to the end isn't for the faint of heart.  We make ourselves vulnerable to public opinions that at times can shift at a moments notice.  But we do it simply because we believe in our projects and wish to see a change that many fans of comics ask for.  This one is no different.  I thank everyone who has pledged and shared.  Let's keep it going.  We have a long way to go and just under 14 days to do so.  I  believe we can do it.

updates.update_userinfo: Icarus & Jellinek A PROJECT WORTH A LOOK
updates.update_content: I believe in supporting indie creators.  This project caught my interest because of  the beautiful art, by Áthila Fabbio in Brazil. This indie press is  producing two graphic novels telling the story of Icarus, a winged young  man  who falls into a dormant volcano with no memory of anything but his  name, and a flamepetal prospector down on his luck, with his two-tailed,  four-legged, lava resistant companion, Rig. It is a story of  compassion, friendship, and the battle to overcome tyranny.  I hope you’ll give it a look.

campaign.story:
WRETCHES is gritty sci-fi epic about a brother & sister who must fight against all odds to be reunited. 
This is a story about family. About loss. All Shea and Sean have is each other...until they don't even have that.
Cover Art by Ben Bishop
WRETCHES - Volume 1 is a sci-fi graphic novel perfect for fans of movies like The Fifth Element & Blade Runner, and shows like Battlestar Galactica & Firefly. At over 150 pages (140 of which are story), readers will get thrown into an action-packed universe filled with beautifully drawn pages and cutthroat characters. In addition to the six-issue tale, backers get to see cover art, pin-ups, script excerpts, and all sorts of other behind-the-scenes content.
I started writing WRETCHES back in 2015. The story and it's characters truly grew with me as a creator these past few years, and thanks to all of YOU, I'm excited to finally be able to put the full story out into the universe! 
 (Click the picture below to ENTER THE IMAGE in 3D on Facebook)
Line Art by Salo Farias. Colors by Ander Zarate.
 SHEA & SEAN 
On the rough streets of an alien planet, far from the one they'd called home, Shea and Sean were forced to grow up with nothing but each other. Forever outrunning the horrors of their past, they survive the only way they know how: by hunting and killing robots for profit!  
Line Art by Salo Farias. Colors by Ander Zarate
When they were just children they watched the war between humans and robots destroy their planet and kill their mother and father.
Interior Art from Issue 3
Now, when Sean is kidnapped by the enemy, Shea has no choice but to tear the entire galaxy apart to find him!
Line Art by Salo Farias. Colors by Ander Zarate.
THE BOTS
The goal of the robots now is simply survival. After fleeing their home, other planets looked at them as lesser life forms. They were given no aid and left without the resources needed to survive, effectively giving them a death sentence! 
Interior Art from Issue 3
Now, on the verge of finding a cure to their newfound mortality, some want to bring peace to their kind. While others threaten to rebuild and destroy those who turned their backs on them!
Interior art from Issue 3
Here's a preview of Wretches - Issue 1.
Since writing issues 1 and 2 several years ago, I've grown as a writer. I took my red pen and did a rewrite to much of them to sharpen things up and give readers a more fleshed out look at the world and it's characters. Below is the opening scene from issue 1, re-written and lettered by the series' new letterer, Chas! Pangburn.
In the never-ending hustle these past years to promote and get Wretches out into the world, we were able to get Issue 1 published in serialized form in China! This was very cool news when it first happened and it's still a great feeling to see your work translated in another language, and published in another country.
 •Every backer of a physical reward will receive this special, Kickstarter-exclusive print.
Kickstarter Exclusive Print
New LIMITED Reward added - only 18 left.
 Click the image for a better look at the prints and their numbered, signed bottom portions.
(CLICK HERE FOR MORE DETAILS ON THE BELOW REWARD AND THE STORY BEHIND US 'GIVING BACK WITH THE 4TH MONKEY')
James E. Roche (creator/writer) - Born & raised in Brooklyn, NY, James now lives in NJ with his wife, 3 kids, 2 cats & 1 goldfish. Self-publishing since 2015, with published work in several anthologies, James co-created, published and edited THE 4TH MONKEY: AN ANTHOLOGY FOR AWARENESS (funded on KS in 2017) featuring the work of 30+ comic book creators. (Imagination House) 
Salo Farias (artist) - Residing in Curico, Chile Salomon is a lifelong sketcher and professional comic book artist since 2011. (IDW. Lakefront Comics) 
Chunlin Zhao (colorist) - Has worked professionally in comics as both a colorist and artist since 2012. (Outlander Entertainment)   
Chas! Pangburn (letterer/editor)- Puts words in balloons... Okay, so that's his cheesy way of saying that he's a comic writer, editor, and letterer. He lives in Northern Kentucky with a chubby corgi and spends far too much time playing video games. (IDW. Heavy Metal. Action Lab: Danger Zone)

Why Kickstarter?
For myself, like so many other creators, Kickstarter has been instrumental towards helping our projects see the light of day. Our work and social media posts caught the eyes of the folks at Scout Comics, who will begin publishing the individual issues in the direct market, hopefully by the end of the year.  Our goal is to put together this Kickstarter Exclusive trade, do a one-time print run, and load it with as much content as we can!
I've already invested thousands of dollars into completing much of the artwork from Issues 3 to 6 (this way the book is completed and into your hands sooner), and the funds raised here on Kickstarter will go towards completing the artwork, coloring & lettering on the remaining pages, as well as funding the print run, shipping & packaging.
Funds raised above and beyond our goal will go into stretch goals for our backers as well as be invested back into the series.

On behalf of the entire creative team, thank you so much for checking out our Kickstarter!
- James
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks when publishing comics and fulfilling backer rewards, as there are multiple parties involved and unforeseen issues cop pop up at any waking moment! As long as we stay on schedule and the printer fulfills their parts without any hiccups (knock on wood) you WILL get this book in a timely fashion once the campaign succeeds.

This is my fifth campaign, and I have delivered on every single successful one thus far. I continue to learn more from each of my campaigns, and will carry that experience into this one.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

This tier adds-on a physical copy of 'The 4th Monkey: An Anthology for Awareness'. When putting the anthology together we wanted to do something to give back some how with post KS sales. campaign.story:
Inside Job is the third issue of our on going series "Adventures of a System Admin". In this particular issue, we find JJ trying to catch a hacker that have been tormenting the company. It seems that the Information Technology (IT) department have caught a break or did they? This issue is full of fun and techie material that even none techie will learn from it. Join us in this funny journey of JJ and his IT crew and see how they defend the company they work at by preventing hackers from stealing information.  
Why are you Kickstarting? 
Hi my name is Juan Espinosa. I'm a System Administrator and a writer. I have found a love for reading comics late in my life, and I decided to create them as well.
This is my first Kickstarter campaign in which I'm debuting issue three of the ongoing series "Adventures of a System Admin". 
I'm running this Kickstarter to get the books into as many people as possible.  I hope that you love reading Adventures of a System Admin as much as I loved writing it. 
Inside Job - Issue 3
About the Comic
Adventures of a System Admin follows the adventures of a college dropout that gets hired as a System Administrator to prevent hackers from infiltrating or extracting sensitive information from the company. Even though JJ dropped-out college, he is very into learning and teaching others as well. 
JJ has become the go to guy at the Information Technology department. He has make some good friends and they always look for him for advise. In the comic we can also appreciate real life tools that anybody can use on their everyday. Tools such as Haveibeenpwned which is a website that allows you to check if your email address has been in a recent security breach, TOR which is a browser that uses the Onion Network that allows the user to be surfing the web anonymous and VPN which stands for Virtual Private Network, encrypts the user's communication preventing your ISP or WiFi provider from seeing your data, this is to mention just a few.   
The main purpose of the comic is somehow to show the readers some technology tools and ways to protect themselves in this new cyber era while telling the story of JJ the System Admin.  

Please find some images from issue 1 and 2 below;
Issue 1
Some pages from issue 1
Issue 2
Some pages from issue 2

STRETCH GOALS
Stretch Goal #1 - $1,300
The first stretch goal will be unlock once we reach $1,300 and everybody at the physical level will receive 2 big pins.

The second stretch goal will be unlock once we reach $1,900 and everybody at the physical level will receive 3 stickers.

updates.update_content: We are super exited that the campaign for Back to Business is live and we are on a great start. We are 90% funded on the first day. Let's keep sharing, talking and promoting the project as we'll need all the help possible. The first 48 hours are crucial for a Kickstarter campaign and we want to keep momentum. Go check it out here; http://kck.st/3fJkL1h

Greetings all,

We hope you are all having a great day and staying safe. The date is set, April 5, 2021 will be the official launch day for Back to Business (Issue 5) of Adventures of a System Admin. We are super exited to share the news and looking forward for your support on April 5. We have plenty of new and good products for you.

Greetings all,

Hopefully everybody is doing great. Just wanted to take this time to share a bit of good news. Happy to announce that in a couple of weeks, we are coming out with Issue 5 of Adventures of a System admin, Back to Business. News with exact dates and plenty of more details coming soon. We will also be sharing a sneak peak for the first couple of page soon. As always, thanks for supporting us with issue 3 and hoping to see you back again on our next adventure. Stay tune but most importantly stay safe.

updates.update_content:
We are excited to announce that our second Kickstarter (Rubber Ducky) have reached its main goal. We are currently in the Stretch Goal phase and have delivered a couple of milestone rewards. If you haven't yet, go check it out and help us reach our first stretch goal. We were also selected a "Project We Love" by Kickstarter. 
Check below a small animated trailer for the new campaign. Hope you enjoy it. Please share with everyone. https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/gordidon/adventures-of-a-system-admin-rubber-ducky-issue-4?ref=discovery&term=Juan%20espinosa
We are happy to announce that our Kickstarter for issue 4 (Rubber Ducky) will go live on February 4, 2020.

Greetings to all,
We are having a sale on our online store starting on Thanksgiving all the way to Cyber Monday. We’ll be offering 25% off on all our items. The shipping is included in the price.
If you did not get a chance to get one of our issues on the Kickstarter, please take advantage of this great offer starting this Thursday. Once again thanks for the support and share it with your friends. Happy Holidays to all!!

Greetings Everyone,
We are happy to announce that we have shipped all rewards to our backers. We like to thank you one more time for the support. We have seem a couple of backers posting pictures with their rewards on social media and we appreciate it. We hope you enjoy the book! Please keep sharing pictures with your rewards on social media, if you would like to tag us, please find our social media information below.

Greetings Everyone,
I just want to thank all of you again for helping me fund my first ever Kickstarter on the latest issue of Adventures of a System Admin!
All of the rewards for which I received surveys have gone out a bit before our target date, Hopefully, no one minds that we were a bit early. If you didn't get a survey please let me know and if you did received it, please fill it out as soon as you can.

campaign.story:
PLAY

Issue 2 of the Wildcard Chronicles is a 32-page full color fast-paced thrill ride set in the Afrofuturistic Tekhen City, a sovereign African city on U.S. soil in a world where the African continent has united to become the world’s greatest superpower!  This is part of an ongoing comic series  being self-published through Burning Spear Comix.
Tekhen City
Super-sized 32-page FULL COLOR issue 
85lb Gloss Varnish 6.625" x 10.25" (standard comic size) 
Digital PDF included with every book 
Digital wallpaper pack with every book 
Digital behind the scenes content including character concepts, comments from the creators, and more! 
Higher tiers for t-shirts, original art, and more!
The story picks up in the final year of "The Last Great War" in 2019CE during the time of the "Mass Awakening" and in the aftermath of the infamous "Night of Reckoning." As Tekhen City rejoices, the corporate world begins to regain its infrastructure as it restarts the "Corporate Initiative." Finding new financial backing, drug cartels and tech tycoons are poised to retake Tekhen City - whoever runs Tekhen controls the entire East Coast.
In a striking master stroke of events, Tekhenʻs big corporations align with the cityʻs newly elected mayor and the drug cartels to shut down the super bike race track, the Giza Grand Prix - a key financial element in New Dendera. This takeover kicks off the legendary Superbike Street Wars, an underground 2-wheel warrior series of street grudge matches that begin in Tekhen City and  spreads around the country.
 We meet a young street racer named Nuri Mauntess as he hears the suspicious news surrounding his father’s death in the Night of Reckoning. As the eldest son and heir to the noble House Mauntess, Nuri must shoulder the weight of his family’s legacy, but is he ready?
House Mauntess
Nuri calls upon his strongest allies to aid in his search for the truth about his father’s death. Along the way, rival biker gangs, shady politicians, and an underground crime syndicate make Nuri’s life a living hell.
In the WildCard Chronicles Universe, we created a diverse cast that were selectively chosen and based on real life heroes within our own communities. Our goal is to bring rich characters with well-thought-out backstories that are tied to their cultural background and ethnicities and to inspire others to "Find the Hero Within."
In Issue 2, we uncover the origins of the House Mauntess as the book opens with the Court of the Black Lions traveling down the Nile River to the place of the “Gathering”, at the Temple of Ramses II aka Abu Simbel.
Abu Simbel
We take powerful Egyptian symbolism, history, and superior technological advances upon which the infamous Giza plateau was built and bring it into the Wildcard Chronicles as the foundation for Tekhen city. Hailed as the Vegas and Silicon Valley of the East, Tekhen is a city full of majestic, mystical wonder and dark secrets.
Flesh Fantasy Five
In the struggle for Tekhen City, loyalties will be tested, bonds will be broken, and heroes will rise from the masses to battle the system created to control them. Will they accept the challenge? Do they have what it takes to bring justice to their city?  Pledge today and find out!
                          Download a FREE copy of Issue 1 NOW!
 All backers at the $29 and above level will also receive this amazing bundle of 10 bonus digital comics courtesy of our fellow independent comic creators!
 JOHN "NURI" MCADAMS - Creator, Author, Owner at Burning Spear Comix
Nuriʻs interview at Blerd Con
Nuri McAdams is the owner of Burning Spear Comix and the genius creative mastermind writing the story of the WildCard Chronicles. Nuri is a US Marine veteran and Motorcycle Club President of the Jokers Revenge Motorcycle Family based in the Washington DC area who utilizes his expertise to bring a bold and edgy perspective to the comic landscape. Nuri draws his artistic and creative inspirations from his life experiences and the heroes he looks up to such as his father John McAdams, Jr, Todd McFarlane, Ken Lashley, Kuen Tang, and more.
ALEXANDRE NASCIMIENTO - Pencils & Inks
Alexandre Nascimiento - Illustrator
Alexandre brings his dynamic artistic talents to the Burning Spear team.  He is a proud father and husband who intentionally works to keep a balanced work and family life. He is a published illustrator for various independent titles such as Rage, Salt City Strangers, and Ruthless.  
YUAN CAKRA - Colors
Yuan Cakra - Colorist
Yuan Cakra is our amazing colorist who continues to deliver the brilliant, eye-catching colors that pop off the pages!  Yuan has been in the comics industry for over 10 years. His body of work includes independent comic titles, as well as some mainstream publishers.  His favorite artist is Alex Ross.  
KUEN TANG - Letters
The Mighty Kuen
Kuen Tang, known as The Mighty Kuen, is the first quadriplegic comic book letterer in the world to work for DC comics. Currently, she letterers for many interesting and independent projects including a few all women collaboration books, artistic poetry books, unlikely super heroes, and motion comics. 
MOHAMMED AGBADI - Concept Art, Logo
Mohammed Agbadi talks about being a concept artist and illustrator
Mohammed is a freelance illustrator who specializes in comic art, concept art, illustration and character design. At a young age Mohammed was exposed to the art of drawing by his mother after she saw his interest in comics and cartoons. Mohammed developed as an artist by creating graphic novels and animated shows. 
MOANA MCADAMS - Editor, Creative Manager 
Moana leverages her leadership, project management, and business expertise and works behind-the-scenes to empower the team to create their best work. She proudly represents Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders in the broader AAPI community and promotes diversity and inclusion to advocate and empower people and cultures not seen in mainstream media.
"Wildcard Chronicles is a fast-paced, action-packed thrill ride. A futuristic, multi-cultural Game of Thrones, only in this world, either you RIDE... or you die." - Tyler James (ComixTribe, ComixLaunch)
"Warring crime syndicates, motorcycle mayhem, and a budding mythology. Wild Cards Chronicles #1 opens up a world that must be explored." - Kevin Joseph, Tart
"A wild blend of ancient Egyptian imagery, neo-noir science fiction, and badass biker action. What's not to love?" - Clay Adams, Fried Comics 
"The storytelling and art have an interesting contrast where you have a dark nature of storytelling but a color palette that really pops and is electrifying when you’re reading it….itʻs a bold move that gracefully pays off.", Victims and Villains
“So, Iʻmma need more Wildcard Chronicles like yesterday.” - Jemarc Axinto, Gamer Guide
".....note the strong female characterization..... incredible sense of self-identification coming through with each character in this issue as well, I would postulate that the writers have put a lot of their own character and energy into developing each role in the comic. Th[is] reinforces the authenticity of each character and brings a new dynamic to the action comic genre." - Chris McAuley, Word of the Nerd
 "...displays a passion not just for the heroes of the racing circuit, but also for a sense of purpose, a sense of pride and honour which seems to have been lost with the postmodern craze of the Anti-Hero. These are characters who have strong ties to ancestral history and to the ties of loyalty ....." Word of the Nerd
"Ever dream of riding your motorcycle through an ancient pyramid on your way to slaughter your enemy? You will tonight, after you finish the Wild Card Chronicles. Sweet dreams!" - Christopher Headmetal, Headmetal Press
The feedback from our growing fan base has been nothing but LOVE for Issue 1 and excited anticipation for Issue 2 which YOU are playing a HUGE role in bringing to reality.  
Fans at Great Philadelphia Comicon
Awesome Con
We really want our children and those for many generations to come to have heroes that they can relate to. We want them to understand that heroes donʻt always wear capes and fly around in the air. There are REAL LIFE HEROES around us everyday and we should aspire to FIND THE HERO WITHIN when life calls us to lead and inspire those around us, while also learning to be accountable for our actions and their impact in our own life and on others.
Inspiring Our Youth
 Therefore, we feel that it is our duty to lead from the front and be the living proof example that fulfilling your dream is possible if you focus your energy, time, heart, and resources into your passions and bringing it to life. 
The Wildcard Chronicles is our legacy, the mark we leave on this world that will survive when we are long gone from it.  We have really BIG plans for our story and where we can take this into the future.  This is just the beginning.  From the bottom of our hearts, THANK YOU SO MUCH for coming along with us on this ride! 
 Who will LOVE WildCard Chronicles?
Fans of the Black Panther, Sons of Anarchy, The Matrix, The Shield, The Godfather, Bladerunner, Supernatural, and The Originals
Fans of neo-noir crime comics like Sin City
Fans of the Joker from DC Comics
Fans of motorcycle comics like Motor Crush, Mayfield Eight, and Lost Dogs MC
Fans hungry for new story lines and heroes
People who live their life for the open road, a need for speed, and the power of two wheels
People who love Africa, specifically Egypt who love the undeniable power and fascination of ancient pyramids 
People NOT from Africa who will enjoy a story where they can learn more about Africaʻs rich cultural history. 
As independent creators and publishers, one of our biggest challenges to getting our passion projects into the world is money/financial resources. We invested our personal funds into starting production on Issue 2 but successfully funding this campaign will help us complete production months ahead of time. This allows us to write and create more quickly so that there is less wait time between issues.
The funds raised will be used to pay our creative team, shipping costs, Kickstarter fees, and payment processing fees. Additional funds over our goal will be put towards creation costs for Issue #3 of the Wildcard Chronicles and will help us get it into your hands as quick as possible!  
Where The Money Is Going
$5 Digital
Digital Deluxe
Physical & Double Digital Pack (Most Popular)
Catch up with both issues!
Limited Edition Kickstarter Variant Cover
Gear up!
Ultimate Game Night Pack!
Original Page Art
Retailer Bundle
Campaign: Sept 26 to Oct 26 
Books Complete: ~Oct 31
Books Goes to Printer: ~Nov 1
Kickstarter Funds Released: ~ Nov 14
Order T-Shirts, Puzzles, Playing Cards, etc: ~Nov 21
Digital Rewards Released: ~Nov 21
Books Printed and Shipped to Burning Spear (4 weeks): ~Dec 1
Buffer for a Series of Unfortunate Events (2 weeks): ~Dec 15
Fulfillment with the Minions (1 weeks): ~Dec 22
Expected Delivery to US Backers: Late Dec 2018 / Early Jan 2019
Expected Delivery to International Backers: Jan 2019
Celebrate fulfillment of an EPIC campaign - 2019 and beyond!
Our goal is to get the best book we can make into your hands as quickly as possible. The team has years of project management experience and one of the lessons you learn very quickly is that you have to factor in time for things that are out of your direct control, especially when external vendors are required to bring your project to life. Weʻve done our best to estimate the time it will take to carry out our master plan and we promise to keep you updated throughout the entire process. And as always, feel free to drop a message or leave a comment anytime and our team will get you squared away!
THANK YOU sooooo much for supporting our campaign!  Words canʻt even begin to express the tremendous love our fans have shown to us over the years and when we are down in the trenches grinding to bring our dreams to life and build a legacy for the next generation, every bit of ENCOURAGEMENT and SUPPORT is a GIFT from the ANCESTORS!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As a fellow Kickstarter backer, we know how much it means to pledge your hard-earned money to a project on this platform. Prior to launching, we have made every effort to minimize the risk to you and we take great pride in delivering a project we - as the creators - can be proud of and you - as our fans - will enjoy for many years to come!

We have been in contact with multiple printers who have successfully printed comics for mainstream and independent creators across the globe. We have chosen Printlore and they are ready to print our books as soon as the art is complete. 

While we are not experts on the Kickstarter platform, we have surrounded ourselves with Kickstarter mentors who have run and fulfilled successful Kickstarter campaigns for years and invested in the ComixLaunch Course and the ComixLaunch Mastermind which helps creators launch the best project possible.

This project is a labor of love and we canʻt wait to put this book into your hands! 

Our goal is to make sure each and every one of our backers leaves extremely satisfied with an amazing experience and hungry for the next issue of the Wildcard Chronicles!

Please reach out to us at any point with your questions and concerns. We promise to provide regular updates and address all of your messages.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: #LadiesInComics panel tonight at 8pm EST - join us!
updates.update_content: Tonight our editor and publisher, Moana, will be a guest speaker on the #LadesInComicspanel for the #DearCreatives podcast. Come and join us to hear about the creative boss babes that are moving and shaking things up in the industry!

updates.update_userinfo: NYCC was a success. Up Next Baltimore!
updates.update_content: Hey backer family! We survived New York Comicon and lived to tell the tale after 4 jam-packed days of creative madness :D Our NYCC exclusive variant covers almost sold out and alot of our readers came back to get the next issue of the Wildcard Chronicles. Weʻre so appreciative of everyone who took the time to come and see us! The main floor was massive and some of our fans did not rest until they found us. Huge shout out for all the love.

updates.update_userinfo: Over the Halfway Hump + Variant Covers!
updates.update_content: Hey Wildcard fans! We are chugging away on our newest project and due to popular demand, we added a new tier to it for our comics family that includes our best-selling limited-edition variant covers for BOTH Issue 1 AND Issue 2!  All in one place PLUS a digital download of our current project, Fishing Day With Papa Ray! This story is perfect for your entire family, especially your kids and grandkids!

Hey Backer Fam,
Hope you enjoyed a wonderful Labor Day weekend. An extra day off is always nice....it gave me the time needed to put the finishing touches on our campaign!  We decided to launch our childrenʻs book project a little early and in just 2 hours,  weʻve already raised over $400 in pre-orders!  You all are AMAZING!!

updates.update_userinfo: Q&A On putting your work out there

updates.update_content:
Hey guys and gals,
Now that the books are on the way and we can breathe a little easier....we are holding a SPECIAL signing tomorrow in partnership with Third Eye Comics in Annapolis, MD for FREE Comic Book Day!  This is our FIRST official event for direct sales of Issue 2 and we are sooo excited to share our hard work with our fellow comic lovers!  
The address is 209 Chinquapin Round Rd #200, Annapolis, MD 21401.
Hey guys! Itʻs been a long time coming and I am happy to say that your books are on the way!  After 2 rounds of shipping.....

updates.update_userinfo: OMG Look At What We Got!
updates.update_content:
After work yesterday, we anxiously awaited our shipment.  We watched our  tracking numbers like a hawk all week. Our printers are in Canada so getting through customs should be a breeze, but we got a notification on Wednesday that they were held back causing a delay.  Uh-oh. How long could this take?  Who knows? Fortunately, it wasnʻt a super long delay and our delivery date got pushed by just ONE day....
At our house, the delivery drivers have a tendency to leave packages in the elements so I posted signs all over to make sure they put our packages under cover because the forecast called for rain.

updates.update_userinfo: Last chance to change your shipping address!
updates.update_content:
Hey backers!
Our books are on the way!!!  We are both excited and relieved! Right now they are sitting in a warehouse in New York and UPS has a delivery date of Thursday afternoon, April 18th. Cross your fingers! Hoping for smooth sailing here on out!
With that said, this is the last call for shipping addresses. If you need to make any changes from your original response, NOW is the time to do so!

campaign.story:
AND NOW... INTO THE SUCK #3!
Our exciting series continues and I hope all of you will come along for the ride!  
For those of you just joining this campaign I thank you for supporting this comic book that we are all so proud of!  I look to the sky and listen to the force because that's where I can find Keith Thomas - the creator, writer and mastermind behind Into the Suck!  I can't believe that it is nearly one year since we lost Keith to cancer.  This book - this series - is a testament to his creativity and passion!  And he would love nothing more than for you to hold this book in your hands, think a little, love it a little and laugh a little!
For those of you that are returning... thank you, thank you, thank you!  I absolutely love issue 3 and I hope you feel the same way when it is all said and done!
Now check out the covers available for this campaign!
Cover A - CB Zane / Colors by Oracle                           Cover B - Tim Seeley / Colors by Oracle
Cover C - Keith Garvey                                                     Cover Naughty Variant - Keith Garvey
Connecting Covers - CB Zane / Colors by Ceci dela Cruz 
Connecting Covers by CB Zane Colors by Ceci dela Cruz
 Here are some pages from the interior of the book!
Need to customize your pledge level - now you can! Just add the additional cost to your current pledge and leave me a message stating which copy/cover you want added to your order!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Right now the risks are very minimal! Issue 3 is completely finished as is issue 4. Issues 5 and 6 just need to be colored and lettered but the art and story is done. The successful funding of this project will pay for the printing of this issue, the rewards, shipping costs, and contribute to the completion of issues 5 and 6.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

project_data.project_name: Into the Suck #3: A sci-fi action comic book

campaign.story:
Ascend: Hell Climber is the first graphic novel in a trilogy by Thomas Pringle, concept artist in the film and game industry (A Quiet Place, Star Trek Discovery, Transformers, Pet Sematary, Neuromancer, Mass Effect, Bioshock). With story editing by Steve Spencer Baker (Slabscape series, Tomato creative collective) and trailer score by Adam Edwards.
The survivors of a downed patrol ship have only one hope of escape: Steal a shuttle from the highest level of an ancient defense tower. But the towers are now home to the mutants and outcasts who were left to rot in the toxic wasteland.
The book runs at 12x8” (30.5x20.3cm) 92 pages in hardcover, signed and numbered by the artist and is inspired by sci-fi films such as Outland and Alien as well as the Heavy Metal magazine stories of the 1970's and '80s.
Also included in the book are 12 pages of full colour concept illustrations showing the world of Ascend in great detail.
The first volume is ready to print and I’m well underway with the second book in the series. I've produced a few test books and the quality is great.
Signed and numbered LIMITED (limited to 10) Kickstarter exclusive print 11x7" (28x18cm).
Signed and numbered LIMITED (limited to 10) Kickstarter exclusive glossy poster 36x24" (91.5x61cm).
About me:

I'm a concept artist and illustrator who's been working in film and games for the last 15 years. Chances are you've seen some of my work if you've watched:
A Quiet Place
Transformers
Star Trek Discovery
Or played:
Mass Effect
Bioshock
Deus EX
Infamous
Call of Duty
And many more...
You can check out more of my work at:
https://www.pringleart.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book is finished!

I finalized the printing quote and done a few test books. The quality is great and I am very satisfied with how its turned out.

The last step is to raise the minimum amount needed to realize the printing. So if this sounds like a project you'd like to support, please do so and in the process receive an awesome book!

Thank you.

Thomas Pringle








COPYRIGHT © MMXVIII PRINGLEART INC
