updates.update_content:
Hello everybody!
Almost all books have been sent out at this point.
The ones that remain to be shipped are:
Double up packages (8 backers)

Hello everyone,
I’ve been busy with organizing, packaging and labeling the remaining orders.
Around 60% of all books have been sent out at this point. if you haven’t received your copy yet its in the process of being sent out shortly!
Thank you again,
Thomas

Hello Everybody,
I have been signing, numbering, packaging, and addressing the books...over half way there! Unfortunately mailing is still an outdated process! I have included an additional Ascend postcard in ALL packages for the delay! I am working on getting these out as quickly as I can! 
Also, for those of you who haven't provided an address please do so as soon as possible.

Hello everybody,
The books have arrived! 
I will be sending out a survey to ask for your address soon. 
Again, sorry for the delay.

So last night I got news from Mark Vierra of OntheMark printing. Here's what he says:
-Pickup at factory tomorrow.
-Estimated Departure from port: 5/31
-Transit time should be 23-26 days.
-After arriving, figure another 6-8 days to clear customs and deliver.
So I'm expecting the books around July 1st and will send them out accordingly.

updates.update_userinfo: Advanced copy of Ascend: Hell Climber
updates.update_content:
Hello everybody,
I'm very happy to announce that I finally got the advanced copy of the book and it looks really great!
The binding, print quality, cover (with the embossed logo) and so forth looks immaculate and I'm very pleased with the result. Still waiting on the finally delivery date and will post it here as soon as I know.

Hello everybody.
So here’s a new update with a bit more specific dates from Mark Vierra of On The Mark printing:
First of all the he says the delay has been caused by the Hong Kong supplier didn’t have the necessary stock at hand.

Hello all,
So I’ve been pushing for more news on a print date over these last few weeks but I still don’t have anything concrete to pass on.
Here is what Mark Vierra (The print guy) told me:
“It still needs to print, as I understand. We were able to slip in the proofing before the holiday. But I don't know yet when the advanced copies will be ready. I'm awaiting info any day. Sorry for the delay on this, ”

Hello and Happy New Year to you all!
I’ve spoken with Mark Vierra who handles the Ascend printing process regarding delivery dates. He told me that the printing  should be commenced and the binding will happen after the Chinese New Year (which ends February 19th).
That’s all I’ve got for now. Once I hear further I will update you all!

I’m happy to announce that I received the final proof for Ascend on December 23rd and it looks fantastic! 
I’ve given the go ahead to start the printing process. If everything goes according to plan I expect to have the books in early February and will ship them out promptly.
Thanks again for your patience and I can assure you that the final quality will be well worth the wait.

campaign.story:
The funds raised with this Kickstarter will allow me to work on and print this book, begin the foundation I will have in Tana and Parkers name and so much more. All of this is for them and in some ways, it brings them here. 
I want this book to be the kind of thing therapists have in their offices. The kind of book, people who have suffered tragedies, can look to for some kind of comfort. 
This book is everything.
Parker and the Soul Guardian
Rough layout for a run in Parker has with a protector of the 1st gate
The Adventures of Parker Reef is a love letter to the life, I, my family and so many people will never get to experience. On March 14th, 2018, my girlfriend Tana and our son, Parker, died in my arms. It was supposed to be the day we welcomed our son into this world. My third child and Tana's first. 
This book (90 + pages) is my way of having them in this world in some way. Loss is always difficult and we all experience the pain of someone leaving us. Be it too soon, or after a life well lived, it hurts the same. No more smiles, phone calls...no more anything.
This story is about Parker's dream to see me in this world and Tana helping him prepare for that dream. Tana always believed you should follow your dream and that is exactly what Parker Reef will be trying to do within these pages. 
Adventure? Well, you can't just choose to leave the after world and just come back. 
You have to earn that. 
In my story, souls are the rarest of treasures. When someone is attempting something like Parker is, ALL are watching. All bets are off and the peaceful land he had been in with Tana is no longer where Parker will be. No, the land Parker will be set in will be dangerous. Full of those souls who have been lost, those souls who did evil while in this world and creatures sent by pure evil to try and stop Parker and covet his soul.  A land full of challenges and adventure. A land Tana has been preparing him for. After all, who knows what their son would wish for more than their parent? 
Rough sketch of the moment before Parker sets off on his journey.
When he sets out on his journey (with the coolest of companions..more on that IN the book) his soul is then "up for grabs" in a sense.
Its not just demons and monsters. The story runs deep Into thoughts on the afterlife. Where do we go? What choices do we really control while living?
If he fails, his soul could be lost forever. 
The most selfless act, to choose to possibly lose your own soul in the attempt to rescue another. 
Demons, lost souls, mazes, incredible lands, sweeping landscapes and one boys journey to risk it all to see the father he never met.
Parker will encounter all sorts of creatures and obstacles during his quest to spend a day with me. With a backpack full of special items given to him by his mother, he will set out on his adventure. The catch...even if he makes it, will I know who he is? After all, we never really got to meet.
The story unfolds like a video game. Different levels and achievements to get to the ultimate goal; A sit down with the Guardian of Souls and entrance to the land of the living.
Will he let Parker pass?
Will Parker be allowed a moment in this world?
Will he stand eye-to-eye with the other half of his heart?
What I can say, is this book is everything to me. You may know me from First World or other books I have worked on. This book, I hope, can help others who have lost, but I truly need it for myself and for those who knew Tana and knew the love she made you feel. 
Thanks for checking out this project.
I am asking for $14,000 to help pay the creative team, print the 90 plus page book and to help fund the foundation for children in Tana and Parker's name. More about that later.
Thanks again!

campaign.story:
So what's this all about?
I'm looking to bring out a paperback version of the first volume of LGBTQ+ superhero series The Pride to bring the comic series to even more people, at a fantastic price. 
 What is The Pride?
The Pride is a comic series about a team of all LGBTQ+ superheroes, representing a broad range of the queer community. Both contextually and metatextually focusing on improved representation and diversity for the community in the superhero format, the comic follows the formation of the team, the individual heroes' personal trials and tribulations and their conflict with a world-threatening villain that they may be the only heroes around capable of stopping. 
Join FabMan, Wolf, Twink, Bear, Angel, Frost, Muscle Mary, White Trash and Cub as they come together to face off against prejudice, the media and of course dastardly super-villains. And then follow them through further adventures as they tackle lucky thieves, bullying, revenge-killers and even a giant evil drag queen. 
The Pride brings all sorts of crazy, fun, wild superhero story adventures for anyone to enjoy. 
What else is it about?
It's also an awesome superhero adventure series consisting a long form main adventure and a series of smaller adventures that build on character and the general drama in a colourful, bright and positive way. 
The Pride by Ricardo Bessa
The paperback book will contain The Pride #1-6, The Pride Adventures #1-4 and behind-the-scenes sketches and designs! 280 pages, at an incredible price!
Wait, you have representation?
Yup, representation is vitally important. Feeling like you are being seen and catered for is a hugely powerful feeling, and despite so many of the LGBTQ+ community being fans of superhero comics and films, it's rare to see people just like them in the medium. 
The Pride aims to change that, with queer heroes as text rather than subtext, and the community as the heroes instead of victims. Featuring gay, lesbian, bi, trans, queer, gender-fluid, drag queens and straight characters working together, and creating a world with the scope to continue building and include more; inclusiveness is a key factor in the series. 
So if you've ever felt like it would be nice to see more of yourself in superhero characters and adventures, then The Pride is for you. And it's also pretty accessible to broad range of ages and demographics whether part of the LGBTQ+ community or not...The Pride is really here for everyone. 
The Pride by Kris Anka
Didn't The Pride get collected before?
Yes, The Pride was successfully Kickstartered and collected as a gorgeous hardcover collection in 2016. 
However, this hardcover is now all but sold out, and it's time to restock with a new edition. 
This time, we're going paperback, to create something that takes up slightly less shelf-space and is available at a much cheaper price to make it accessible to even more people.
The Pride Volume One Paperback edition will contain The Pride #1-6, The Pride Adventures #1-4 and all the behind-the-scenes content of sketches, designs and more, so you'll be getting all that amazing content at an incredible price. 
The Pride by Cory Smith
So why Kickstarter?
This campaign is just to raise the funds to cover the print costs for this new edition, so I can keep bringing The Pride to more people who want and need it, in a new, inexpensive and accessible format. 
No new content to be produced, no new merchandise to produce, just a simple fund raise to cover printing costs for a new edition of the first volume of the LGBTQ+ superhero adventure series only. As such, I'll be running it much more streamlined and straight-forward than usual. 
As you'll see there are just a handful of reward options, for a copy of the book digitally or in the new paperback edition; or with the latest issue The Pride Adventures #5 to add with your book, and even a special option to get a batch of five copies, ideal for stores or groups looking to get the series. 
The button badges designs!
There's also options to get the book with bookmarks, buttons and some our fabulous enamel pins!
Bear Pin, designed by Gavin Mitchell
Angel Pin, designed by Gavin Mitchell
Also, for all single copy tiers, there's free UK shipping!
So please consider joining us on this journey to have fun, accessible and inclusive superhero stories that everyone can enjoy. 
The Pride by Jamal Campbell
About the creator
I'm Joe Glass, the writer and creator of The Pride. I wrote the majority of the series, with two shorts written by Mike Garley and PJ Montgomery in Volume One. I've been making The Pride for around eight years now, and have seen the series go from humble beginnings to an international and broad audience of readers the world over. 
With a wide team of incredible creators (a full list can be found below), I put the series together as it was something I wanted to see in comics, both now and when I was a teen coming to terms with my own sexuality and finding solace in comic books. 
Muscle Mary by Kris Anka
I've run several campaigns in the past, including the hardcover edition of the first volume, a special limited edition pin design, and recently the very first new issue of content in the series. All have been successful, and have either already been fully fulfilled or will be shortly. 
My hope is to keep bringing inclusive, diverse comics out that everyone can enjoy, and for those under-represented by the medium to feel they can be part of it too. And all the while, have fun and be positive in my superhero stories. 
Praise for The Pride
The Pride #1 was one of the Top 25 Best Selling ComiXology Submit Titles of 2014. 
"You should support The Pride because it's an important book, but you should REALLY support it because it's a great read. Fun, smart, high-stakes, but above all heartfelt - full of rich, complex characters sure to become some of your new favorite superheroes." - Scott Snyder, Batman, Justice League, Wytches
"I highly recommend this smart, charming, wonderful book to anyone who likes good comics. It's absolutely a pleasure to read and a clear labor of love." - Gail Simone, Batgirl, Domino, Clean Room
Frost by Maxime Garbarini & Hector Barros
"The Pride manages to deliver a lot of enjoyment with a lot of potential to soothe the queer soul." - Comicosity
"THE PRIDE. Old-School and Progressive at the same time. Classic, high-energy superhero action that gives the queer community the heroes they've always deserved." - Steve Orlando (Midnighter, Justice League of America, Crude, Virgil)
FabMan by Maxime Garbarini & Hector Barros
"The Pride is equal doses of action, drama, celebration, transgression, campy humor, legit humor, and a slew of other descriptors that best qualify a team book following a fabulous crew of complicated heroes as they work together to kick butt and look gorgeous." - Sina Grace, Iceman, Nothing Lasts Forever
The Pride #1 art by Gavin Mitchell & Kris Carter
"A series worth reading. All the characters are fleshed out and drawn with charm & care. Amazing storylines that impact many. I hope more amazing team members get introduced & involved, soon! Also: FabMan, Cub, Wolf, and many more on the Pride team are definitely a team that's got your back & I'm glad they've got mine." - Elijah Knight, GeeksOUT
The Pride Adventures #4 cover by Hamish Steele
"The Pride is immediately appealing with its range of characters that play off of superhero and queer community archetypes. What surprised me was how these archetypes developed into the nuanced characters, brutally honest storylines and complex relationships that any superhero comic would be envious of." - Hamish Steele, Deadendia, Pantheon, Eisner winner of the Russ Manning Most Promising Newcomer Award 2018
The Pride Adventures #2 art by Christian Wildgoose & Ben Wilsonham. Letters by Mike Stock.
"The Pride is the kind of book that makes you realize, there was something missing all along and you hadn't known it. Its colorful, energetic nature only serves to underscore its nuanced emotional core." - Vita Ayala, The Wilds, Livewire, Supergirl)
"You don't have to be LGBTQ+ to enjoy these comics. If you liked the mix of superhero action, personal issues, and expansive compassion of classic Claremont X-Men - get the modern version right here!" - James Asmus, Quantum & Woody, Thief of Thieves, Gambit, Bumblebee, Evolution

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Unlike other campaigns where new content or merchandise is being created, this campaign is simply to raise the funds for the printing of a new edition of the first volume of The Pride. As such, the book files are ready to send to the printers already and as long as we hit target they'll be sent straight through for some quick and easy reward fulfilment.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We've hit our first goal! But there's still SO MUCH we can achieve with your additional support. Join the movement TODAY before it's too late.
Scroll to the bottom for more info!
Malika Animated Pilot - Behind The Scenes Part 1
Malika Animated Pilot - Behind The Scenes Part 2
Malika Animated Pilot - Behind The Scenes Part 3
Malika Animated Pilot - Behind The Scenes Part 4
My name is Roye Okupe, and I am the CEO of YouNeek Studios. Some of you may know me as the writer/creator/publisher of the award-winning graphic novel series Malika & E.X.O. However, today I'm here to talk to you about a different topic.
A little over three years ago I quit my full-time job to start YouNeek Studios. I did so because all my life I've wanted to create stories that are inspired by African history, culture and mythology. Until this point, I have fulfilled this goal successfully by publishing graphic novels.
My books have been successful due to an amazing group of fans that constantly support my projects. Everything I've created and achieved up to this point has led me to this moment. I know that it is now the time to move into the realm of animation!
Malika Teaser Animation Mood Boards by Godwin Akpan
Animation? Yes, you heard that right! YouNeek Studios has decided to officially move forward with production of the Malika: Warrior Queen animated pilot/episode one. It's a 3D animated episode (7-minutes long) that I will be writing and directing. The amazing guys at Anthill (who did the animated teaser for our Kickstarter video) will be handling pre-production and production, and YouNeek Studios will take care of post-production.
Our goal is to start small by creating one 7-minute episode that can act as both a pilot and as the beginning of a series (episode one). We need to raise about $15,000 to cover the entire animation production costs. We understand that there will be some other costs (post-production, miscellaneous additional and unexpected costs etc.), but as a company, we are also going to be investing our time and money to handle those things.
The cool thing is that if we're able to exceed our goal, we can do even more! So in theory, just with this Kickstarter, we can produce not only episode one but two, three, four or perhaps an ENTIRE season or movie! Basically, the more money we raise the more episodes we can produce! Check out the stretch goal section below for more info on this.

Concept Art by Godwin Akpan

Why Malika? I could say we chose this story because it's an award-winning graphic novel series. Or because it's the only African comic to ever be featured during Diamond Comics Free Comic Book Day (2017/18) and Halloween Comic Fest 2017, with comic book stores ordering more than 100,000 copies for those events combined. Or the fact that it features a badass African female lead character. 
But the simple answer? It’s all of the above.
Malika Warrior Queen Poster by Godwin Akpan
Synopsis 
Set in fifteenth-century West Africa, Malika: Warrior Queen follows the exploits of Queen and military commander, Malika, who struggles to keep the peace in her ever-expanding empire. Growing up as a prodigy, Malika inherited the crown from her father in the most unusual of circumstances, splitting the Kingdom of Azzaz in half. After years of civil war, Malika was able to unite all of Azzaz, expanding it into one of the largest empires in all of West Africa.
Malika Poster by Mohammed Agbadi
But expansion would not come without its costs. Enemies begin to rise within her council, and Azzaz grabbed the attention of the most feared superpower the world has ever known: the Ming Dynasty. As Malika fights to win the clandestine civil war within the walls of her empire, she must now turn her attention to an indomitable and treacherous foe that plans to vanquish her entire people. From dragons to mythical relics, a feuding royal family and magical swords, the story of Malika: Warrior Queen stays true to the fantasy genre while adding something new by setting familiar concepts in an awe-inspiring African setting.
What Make's Malika Unique?
Malika Teaser Animation Mood Boards by Godwin Akpan
Malika - Warrior Queen showcases the majesty and awe that is medieval West Africa. The costumes, character design, and set pieces all serve to highlight a robust diversity of culture and tradition based on real history. While Malika and her empire of Azzaz are fictional, they are surrounded by actual African states and rulers: bordered to the south by the Oyo, Nri, and Benin Kingdoms; to the west by the Songhai Empire and Timbuktu; and to the east by the Kingdom of Kongo. 
Concept Art by Godwin Akpan
Azzaz is itself divided into five provinces, each with their local traditions and customs. This amalgamation of African cultures sets the stage for an epic adventure, all as told through the eyes of Malika. As the Empire of Azzaz and the Ming Dynasty, clash, breathtaking fantastical elements (magic, relics, and dragons) are introduced via ancient mythological artifacts and beings called The Divine Ones. Focus is placed on two such artifacts: Dragon’s Destiny, a sword whose powers feed on the wielder’s courage, and Dragon’s Doom, whose powers feed on the wielder’s rage.
The Characters
Queen Malika 
Malika Character Design by Godwin Akpan
A master duelist and battle strategist by the age of 8, Malika was a child prodigy born to rule. However, she quickly realizes just how heavy the crown is after ascending to the throne following the loss of both parents during the civil war. Determined to make a better future for Azzaz, Malika ends the civil war by uniting all the neighboring kingdoms into one empire. This attracts danger from the outside in the form of the Ming Dynasty, as well as betrayal from within the walls of her empire. These, however, turn out to be the least of Malika’s problems as a cloud darkness approaches Azzaz. Malika must now look to divine power to restore hope to a fractured empire.
General Cheng 
General Cheng Character Design by Godwin Akpan & Kaiju Den LLP
General Cheng, an accomplished voyager and military tactician, was sent by the Emperor of the Ming Dynasty to Atala to peacefully investigate the presence of ancient and very powerful relics called the Dragon Stones. Upon his failure to form an alliance with the Atalians, Cheng went rogue and set his eyes on the Empire of Azzaz and Malika herself after she offers aid to Atala.
King Bass (The WindMaker) 
WindMaker Character Design by Godwin Akpan
Ever the curious warrior, Bass Kazaar found the Wind Stone, one of four ancient dragon relics, and became The WindMaker. With his newfound powers to manipulate the wind as well as the strength of the Red Raven Army, protectors of the Kingdom of Atala, behind him, Bass goes on to drive Cheng and his forces away from his homeland. Following this victory, Bass is crowned the first-ever King of Atala. Knowing that Cheng would not stop until he gets what he wants, Bass journeys to Azzaz to seek an alliance with Queen Malika.
Abdul 
Abdul Character Design by Godwin Akpan
As First Minister of Azzaz, Abdul is second in command to Malika. Having trained her since she was six, Abdul is more of an adopted father to her. Ever the over-protective guardian, he will go to any lengths to ensure Malika’s safety as Queen.
Chief Dogbari 
Chief Dogbari Character Design by Godwin Akpan
Chief Dogbari is a member of The Council of Five, a group of leaders selected from each of the five provinces in Azzaz to advise Queen Malika. While each member of the council is supposed to have a say in matters of the empire, Chief Dogbari, due to his political stature, speaks for the entire council. He is also the governor of the Fon Province.
Map of Azzaz (Design by Paul Louise-Julie)
Key locations 
Although Malika’s Azzazian Empire and The WindMaker’s Kingdom of Atala are both fictional places, the world they inhabit is very real, as can be seen from the map above. People familiar with African history will definitely recognize names such as Timbuktu, The Songhay Empire, The Oyo Empire, The Benin Empire, etc. Malika: Warrior Queen is sprinkled with MANY Easter eggs regarding African history!
Malika Teaser Animation Mood Boards by Godwin Akpan
 Anyone who knows the slightest thing about animation knows just how expensive and difficult it can be to produce. For ten years, I've tried to go through conventional channels, putting together a pitch bible and pitching to investors, distributors, networks, and producers. And while I've been able to get close a couple of times (I've met some amazing producers/people who continue to do what they can to help), it has just never happened.
This is why I chose to go the crowdfunding route. After all, I've been able to fund all four of my graphic novels via Kickstarter, and I have the same faith that this will be successful, too.
Concept Art by Godwin Akpan
If you want to see more representation on-screen, you are in search of new and unique stories, or you love or want to learn more about African culture, history, and mythology, then I am making this for you. 
This is a story inspired by African history that ANYONE from ANY part of the world can relate to and enjoy.
However, I can't create this animation without your help. So I hope that you choose to pledge :) Every single, pledge, tweet, share, and comment counts! 
So what do you say? Do you wanna help me bring something "YouNeek" to the animation industry?
 
Malika Teaser Animation Mood Boards by Godwin Akpan
Our goal is to start small by creating one 7minute episode that can act as both a pilot and as the beginning of a series (episode one). We need to raise about $15,000 to cover the entire animation production costs. We understand that there will be some other costs (post-production, miscellaneous additional and unexpected costs etc.), but as a company, we are also going to be investing our time and money to handle those things.

The cool thing is that if we're able to exceed our goal, we can do even more. Basically, the more money we raise the more episodes we can produce! Check out the stretch goal section below for more info on this.
Concept Art by Godwin Akpan
As with any other YouNeek project (our graphic novels, comics, etc.), everything we do is self-funded/bootstrapped, and as always, we truly believe in our fans (current and prospective). We know that as long as we continue to produce quality products and treat our fans like family, there's no project that's too big to attempt. 
I believe that this is no different.
Where Does The Money Go?
Malika Teaser Animation Backgrounds by Godwin Akpan
Should we be funded (fingers crossed), it will take about 4 months from the moment that we commence work with Anthill until we wrap up the final edit.
Potential delays may arise as a result of:
Working with people in multiple time zones
Edits
Shipping to you
Unforeseen circumstances
This will be my fifth Kickstarter, so the plan is to use all my experience to make this process as glitch-free as possible.
Other costs include:
Post-production
Rewards production
Shipping
Miscellany
All of these costs will be covered by YouNeek Studios.
"Malika is the sort of tale that can be appreciated by a wide audience. An engaging tale of justice, bloodshed, wrath, and love, its mythic lessons of good and evil will echo true in many people’s hearts. Its serious subject manner makes it appealing to adult audiences, while its restrained use of violence and the relative absence of blood and gore make it appropriate for children as well. Book 2 took Malika to places I had never expected her to go, making me excited to see what will happen in her future and how her journey fits into the larger story of the Youneek Youniverse as a whole."
- Culture Honey
Roye Okupe | Creator/Writer/Director
Born in Lagos, Nigeria, Roye Okupe is an author, speaker and entrepreneur whose passion for animation led him to found YouNeek Studios in 2012, an avenue that would allow him to pursue his dream of creating a diverse library of superheroes. Under that umbrella, Roye wrote, produced and directed several animated productions including, but not limited to, 2D/3D animated short films, TV commercials, show openers, music videos and much more. These productions have allowed Roye to attain many prestigious recognitions such as being #5 on Ventures Africa’s list of 40 African innovators to watch (2016) as well as being part of NewAfrican Magazines’ 100 most influential Africans two years in a row (2016 & 2017).
Niyi Akinmolayan | Executive Producer
Niyi Akinmolayan is a Nigerian film-maker, director and media consultant. He is best known for directing the highest grossing Nigerian film of all time, The Wedding Party 2, which starred Banky Wellington, Adesua Etomi and Enyinna Nwigwe; it was a sequel to the equally successful film The Wedding Party(2016).[1] He is the founder and Creative Director of Anthill Productions, a media production an animation studio in Lagos Nigeria.
Godwin Akpan | Senior Digital Artist
Godwin discovered the digital canvas in the early days of the computer revolution in Nigeria. Having trained as a traditional artist in college, Godwin brings his unique set of skills into creating digital masterpieces. His character design works have been featured in major digital art forums worldwide. He also lectures digital art in masterclasses with the comic panel academy. Check his portfolio here. He creates storyboards, concept art and matte painting here at the studio.
Eri Umusu | Lead CG Artist
Eri is undoubtedly one of Nigeria's best when it comes to 3D modeling, animation and visual effects. A self-taught artist, Eri leads a team of animators in the studio to create pristine work of art. He had his directorial debut with The Sim, and further challenged himself with the rest of the team to produce an animated short PlayThing which is currently the most popular 3d animation in Nigeria.
He is a star in the 3D community, and frequently organizes workshops and lectures on computer animation. Eri hopes to be a Japanese samurai one day.
Fem D | Composer
Fem D is a multi-faceted music producer, filmmaker, composer and sound designer with an undeniable passion for the arts and an affinity for fearless innovation that’s clearly expressed in his compositions. 
As a Grammy Voting member with the Recording Academy and founder of iAmazeMusic, the DMV based producer has spent over a decade crafting his sound. He has always been driven with the philosophy that it’s not enough for the music to be good… it has to be great. 
Fem D has produced several albums that have garnered acclaim in the United States and overseas, and has had his music placed in TV and film. 
He is also an educator, mentoring aspiring music producers, artists and indie filmmakers to transition from dreamers to music entrepreneurs. For more information on how to book Fem D, please contact him at info@iamazemusic.com.
About YouNeek Studios
Simply put, through the use of comics, animation, videos games and other forms of media, we focus on telling extraordinary stories about extraordinary characters inspired African history and culture.
$20,000 - Star Actor
We'll approach a star Nollywood Actor/Actresses to voice 1 of the main characters.
$26,000 - 30 Second Post-Credit Scene.
It's not a superhero story without a post-credits cliff-hanger. This will also give hints as to where episode two and the entire season is going.
$35,000 - 1-minute Episode 2 Teaser
We'll create a 1-munited animated clip of the beginning of episode two so you can get a glimpse of how the story unfolds.
$40,000 - 1-minute E.X.O. Animated Teaser
It is important to note that Malika's world is just one corner of the behemoth that is the YouNeek Youniverse. A world filled with stories (fantasy, sci-fi, steampunk, historical fiction, etc.) that feature compelling heroes and villains. All of whom have their roots in, and are inspired by, African history, culture, and mythology. Should we reach this mark, we'll give you a taste of what
$60,000 - Malika - Warrior Queen Episode 2!!!
We'll deliver an ADDITIONAL 6 - 7-minute episode!
You hear the word "representation matters" thrown around a lot. But I wanted to describe to you exactly what it means with a true story.
A friend of mine once told me a story. He said one day while grabbing my book in a comic book shop, he saw a young girl browsing the shelves. She stumbled upon my book Malika: Warrior Queen and her eyes lit up! Immediately, she started to call out to her father "Daddy! Daddy! Come see!" Her father hurried to see what all the fuss was about. And when he got there she said to him "Look, daddy, she looks like me!"
This stuff matters.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Having run 4 successful Kickstarter (and delivering all rewards to all backers) before, I am fully confident and also very well prepared to run this Kickstarter smoothly. However, should any issues arise, I plan on handling them in a professional manner. I will also be sending frequent messages via the Kickstarter updates thread to keep everyone informed on progress. I believe in 100% transparency and you guys deserve nothing less.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hey guys!
Just wanted to give a quick update.
We're all but done with cloth simulation and hair. And we're moving on to rendering. Which is the final phase.
We're still on track to be done in about 2 weeks.

Hey guys!
So I know I mentioned we'd be done by end of March but we ran into some issues with cloth and hair simulation :(
Good news is that EVERYTHING else is done. Modelling, animation, lighting, texturing etc. We just hit some road blocks with cloth and hair.

campaign.story:
Stealth has been in development for over a year with the actual Publisher of Short Fuse Media Group, Sean Mack at the helm writing the plots along with series creator William Satterwhite churning out the dialog. After a ton of work going into this project Stealth is finally ready to take center stage as the newest addition to our stellar superhero line up of titles spearheading our Red Band division of titles.
Stealth #1 Cover
Stealth follows the story of Allen White as he navigates Terminus City as a school teacher by day attempting to educate the youth on real life issues and why those real life issues should matter to them. However, by night, Allen provides an entirely different education to the underworld and evildoers of Terminus City as the vigilante hero known to the public as Stealth.
So why are we bringing this project to Kickstarter? The short answer...we need the funding to continue to produce and print these books! The long answer....we LOVE being a part of the RESPONSIBLE Kickstarter community that commit to delivering new and AWESOME projects to our supporters within the community. And to be quite honest, we feel that this title fills a much needed void in regards to diverse content on our roster as well as in indie comics overall, similar to how the newly released Black Panther movie from Marvel Studios is filling a similar void in movie theaters.
Stealth #0 Limited Preview Edition Cover
We felt this way so much so that we partnered up with multiple charitable organizations like Hero Nation (Ypsilanti) and The Mighty Jon Youth Movement to offer free issues of Stealth #0 to over 500 kids during the youth screenings of the film! 
Hero Nation Announcing that we donated copies of Stealth #0!
Fans Getting Copies of Stealth #0 at Mighty Jon Youth Screening Event!
We feel that this project can have a greater amount of reach to fans that will appreciate new and diverse superhero stories using a direct market approach as opposed to going through costly distributors. We've proven this fact with our "#WeAlwaysDeliver Campaign Promise" that has allowed us to deliver our books directly to our backers immediately following the completion of our campaigns!!! Our aim and GUARANTEE is to continue  that trend with this project as well. 
All of the funding will go towards the production of new issues including expenses for the creative team to make this project perfect! The books are complete with only some fine tuning being done to them!!! Other than  checking a last round for editorial concerns, we're ready to head off to the printer so we can get these books into your hands!!! Check out some of the pages below!
From the onset Stealth is heavy on the action!!!
Stealth is heavy on character interaction....
But Stealth is also heavy on "REAL HUMAN STORIES" and world building!!!
We have some really cool rewards and really wanted to focus on the core of what this campaign was about so we tried to keep it pretty simple. Check out a more detailed look below at some of the rewards that we have lined up for this campaign.
For starters, we truly felt that this campaign wouldn't be right without going back to the early adventures of Stealth when he was first getting started in Terminus City via the Life & Times of Allen White Graphic Novel Preview. 
Stealth Original Graphic Novel Preview Cover
Next up is the Stealth #0 Special Limited Preview Edition that we released as a primer for this series. Following this campaign, we'll never be offering this title again as there were only a limited number of copies printed. 
We also have the official 32 Page Giant Sized debut issue of Stealth #1 in all of its glory!!! This issue is a phenomenal debut that perfectly introduces you to Stealth and the inner workings of Terminus City. We are  extremely proud of this book as the production team really kicked it up a notch to produce an amazing comic. And yes, as awesome as the cover is, the interiors are from the same team (as that is a staple that we are pretty consistent with).   
Stealth #1 Cover A
If you just want a fix of various comics from our Red Band Division, we are offering our Red Band Bundle as a digital or physical reward  featuring ALL of the titles that are available from our Red Band line including Stealth #1! 
Red Band Bundle (Digital or Printed)
We do, however, enjoy seeing talented artist giving their take on our characters. And this project is no different. So we brought on Zenescope artist Sean Hill to illustrate a limited edition Variant Cover B. As you can see, Sean totally KILLED IT on this cover!!!  
Stealth #1 Variant Cover B by Sean Hill
We didn't stop there though as we also brought on Image Comics artist Caanan White for another very special limited print edition virgin variant cover (CVR C). What's special about this book is that it will be exclusively printed in Black and White as this is a staple that we have done with several titles within our Red Band division and these versions always look AMAZING! 
Stealth #1 Virgin Variant Cover C by Caanan White
We also threw in a few items of apparel for you to show Stealth some love with our "Gear Up" Rewards. 
Stealth T-Shirt
Stealth Baseball Shirt
Stealth Hooded Sweatshirt
Of course any Kickstarter campaign from us wouldn't be complete without the option of getting custom action figures of our characters (or your own) so check out the packaging and figure for Stealth!  
Fully Packaged Custom Stealth Action Figure
We've also brought back the Cameo Cover Variant so if you want yourself or your character featured on the cover with Stealth this would be the perfect option for you.
See yourself or your character on the cover!!!
We're also using this campaign as the soft debut for our Indieverse Unlimited Action Figure Line where you can be the first to get an official Stealth action figure or even an action figure of your own original character, courtesy of our new division Legion XIV Productions. We've been working on transitioning away from custom figures in order to launch a full action figure line featuring our characters and this is merely the first phase as we have a already been planning the first WAVE. 
INDIEVERSE UNLIMITED STEALTH ACTION FIGURE
You can only add items that are in reward tiers that are lower than your primary selected reward tier. If you wish to pledge for items that are in a higher reward tier, you must select that reward tier as your primary reward tier at minimum. Duplicate items from that reward tier or lower reward tiers can be added by increasing your pledge using the pricing below.   
Comic Books - (no increase in shipping fees)
Add $5.00 for additional copies of Stealth #1 CVR A  
Add $10.00 for additional copies of Stealth #1 CVR B
Add $15.00 for additional copies of Stealth #1 CVR C
Add $5.00 for any additional comics from our online store
Apparel - 
Stealth T-Shirts: Add $25.00 (includes shipping)
Stealth Baseball Shirt: Add $35.00 (includes shipping)
Stealth Hooded Sweatshirt: Add $45.00 (includes shipping)
Custom Action Figures - 
Custom Stealth Action Figure: Add $90.00 (includes shipping)
Your Custom Action Figure: Add $120.00 (includes shipping)
NOTE: Indieverse Unlimited Action Figures are not available as add ons.
Our first stretch goal will team up Stealth and Spirit's Destiny in a beautiful print from Spirit's Destiny series artist Julie Anderson!!! 
Stealth / Spirit's Destiny Print by Julie Anderson
Our second stretch goal will score everyone some additional comic swag featuring more of "our" heroes as physical rewards will receive this awesome "Our Heroes" print and EVERY backer will receive PDF copies of Hotshot #1, Pinkwing And The Prime-Controller #1, Vigilance #1 and Tezla #1 along with the digital wallpaper of "Our Heroes". 
Our Heroes Bundle
Our third stretch goal will help us celebrate the one year anniversary of Stealth debuting with Short Fuse Media Group as we revisit the Heroes: Ignited Anthology where Stealth made his first appearance with us. Every backer will receive the digital PDF of the anthology as well as a digital PDF of Indy Comic Premiere Magazine that features an interview with Stealth series creator William Satterwhite talking about the series. 
Heroes: Ignited Bundle
Our fourth stretch goal unlocks an AWESOME connected pin up featuring our entire Red Band line up starting with Stealth. Each of the following stretch goals unlock a new pin up that connects to the image. But we wanted to make our next stretch reward a bit different...so hitting funding milestones will surely unlock the entire connecting pin up. However, hitting 200 backers will unlock this entire pin up as well. Backers receiving digital rewards will only get the digital image and backers getting physical rewards will get physical prints of each unlocked pin up.  
Red Band Connecting Pin Up
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As we did on our previous two campaigns......THIS CAMPAIGN WILL BEGIN DELIVERING REWARDS THE SAME WEEK THE CAMPAIGN ENDS!!!

We've managed all of the risks associated with this project by doing the leg work before this campaign's launch.

We understand the importance of fulfilling our promises and always ensure that all of our supporters receive their rewards. And we always find ways to sneak extra swag into our reward packages as a thank you for the patience in supporting our projects on the front end and patiently waiting for them to be completed and delivered....so we can focus on the fun part.....making comics!!!

It's because of your continued support that we are able to make these AWESOME comics! And for that we truly appreciate ALL of our backers and keep a wide open form of communication for you all to reach us at any time.

So what are you waiting for! Check out the rewards to the right and sign up to get in on the action! Share this campaign with your friends and family that LOVE comics like us. And stay tuned for more announcements throughout this entire campaign. Thanks for checking out this campaign. We hope you will become a backer.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Don't Miss Out On More Awesome Comics from Short Fuse Media Group!!!
updates.update_content:
Hey Guys!!! Just wanted to pop in with a quick update to let you know that we are in the final 2 weeks of our latest launch on Kickstarter for our Heroes International Series from our Freestyle Komics imprint (the same good folks that brought you Hotshot and Vigilance)!!!! 
The series focuses on a superhero team just like any other popular superhero team from Marvel or DC with one exception...They Suck!

updates.update_userinfo: SUPPORT THE NIOBE KICKSTARTER FROM OUR FRIENDS AT STRANGER COMICS!!!!
updates.update_content:
Check out this AWESOME Project!!!
NIOBE RETURNS TO RECLAIM HER THRONE! Stranger Comics launches an opportunity to get limited exclusives of new comic NIOBE: She is Death issues 1 and 2 by Amandla Stenberg (The Hate You Give, Hunger Games) before it hits stores. She is Death follows the critically acclaimed first series, NIOBE: She is Life, which shattered barriers and made history becoming the first nationally distributed comic with a black female author (Amandla), artist (Ashley A. Woods), and hero (Niobe) in the history of comics. Oscar winner Viola Davis wrote the foreword in the hardcover. Black Girl Nerd Magic!

updates.update_userinfo: Follow Us on Kickstarter for MORE Awesome Projects!!! #WeAlwaysDeliver
updates.update_content:
We have a roster of AWESOME creators and are always preparing a new project for release. The benchmark on new releases that we set for ourselves is to ensure that we have done the bulk of the fulfillment on ANY of our previous campaigns before launching a new campaign. So our hope is that if you like the content that we release, that you'll follow us on Kickstarter so that you notified every time we launch a new project!!! 
With that said, we have a new campaign running right now for our first collected trade of Like Father, Like Daughter. The story is about a teenage girl whose father left her at a young age to become a full time superhero. She has to deal with seeing her father everywhere and the world loving him while she views him in his true colors as a man who abandoned his true responsibilities.

Hey Guys,
As promised...with the exception of customized items, all book rewards have shipped on this campaign so if you have not received your books or a tracking number (via email), feel free to reach out to us direct and we'll be sure to get you all sorted out. 
Beyond that...We have just over 1 hour left on our "Bringing Alignment to the Indieverse" campaign at https://kck.st/2JLmbFL. Help us close this campaign out strong so we can deliver another batch of awesome indie comics!!!

Hey Guys,
Just wanted to follow up and let you all know that shipping is still on schedule and that with the exception of customized rewards, EVERYONE should have their rewards during the month of June. We have shipped about 90% of the physical rewards. Aiming to have the rest done this week so if we've messaged you about additional info, or if you haven't completed your reward survey, please do so ASAP so we can get your package shipped. If you haven't received a tracking number via email yet, you're package is still being finalized but rest assured, you'll be notified of it shipping soon.

Hey Guys,
Just wanted to follow up with you all about your digital rewards. All digital rewards were  sent via Kickstarter message as opposed to email. ALL digital rewards were delivered on May 24th (as long as your pledge had cleared...if your pledge cleared after that, we sent the rewards then). So if you think you didn't get your digital rewards, please refer to your Kickstarter messages (again...not your email).

Hey Guys,
Just wanted to pop in with a quick update. For any backers that did not have signed copies in their rewards packages, if you haven't received your package or a tracking number already, you should have it by Monday at the latest as we work through the list. We got backed up this week as a few of us were at conventions. 
Anyone who had books that were being signed, we are just waiting on the books to be shipped back from the creator, William Satterwhite, adorned with his beautiful signature. I'll do my signing once the books are back here with us and then those will ship out immediately. So rest assured everything is right on schedule and 90% of you will have your reward packages during June.

campaign.story:
Being an artist can sometimes feel like playing hopscotch in a minefield. 

Imagine posting artwork online that you're proud of only to be met with accusations of racial stereotyping, fat-phobia, colorism, transphobia and just all around insensitivity.
Artists can often feel sucker punched by audiences at large and suddenly find themselves trending on social media for all the wrong reasons. 
Granted, you can never control how the world reacts to your art, but what if there was a book that could elucidate the problems before you start and help you understand where people are coming from? 
That's what "How to draw black people" is all about. 

The first in a planned series of books that focus on the culture of people of color, rather than just the aesthetics. 
The unwritten idea, but tangible logic, that "if you can draw a white person you can draw anyone" just won't cut it anymore. 

Audiences are asking for diversity and authentic characters based on real cultures. The teachings we have now are woefully out of date and never touch on ways to depict more that what lies on the surface. 
Not Just another "How to" Book.
Tutorial on hair
How to Draw Black People isn't a book where artists are provided with facial grids and examples of modelesque people, with some cool poses to try and emulate. 

While there will be step by step guides artists are accustomed to, this book will include entire sections devoted to: 
Anatomy
Facial anatomy  
Facial expressions
Hair
Skin tone
Costuming 
Culture and customs 
And within these sections we delve deeper into things like colorism, fatphobia, gender expression, and how all these things play into visualizing black characters. Everything cited and sourced, all the research done so artists can trust the info or hopefully use it as a starting point learn more.   
Crowdfunded and Crowd Sourced. 
While I will supply the bulk of tutorials and tips provided in the book multiple talented artists will also give their take on how to approach each topic; how to apply what's being highlighted in different styles, and give their own take on what they believe is important when it comes to creating diverse characters. 

Also in the book will be a wealth of photo reference for artists to take advantage. A compilation of everyday black folks across the African diaspora. Special attention will be paid to the differences between drawing someone from the west indies, Ethiopia, Brazil or South Africa. 
Learn how to depict culture instead of stereotypes 
 Artists often feel like they don't know what will draw the ire of a socially conscious community, and they are right; they don't know. Artists are taught by and large to copy but rarely to intuit. Art courses require us to recreate and translate without necessarily understanding the subject. 

That lack of understanding is the cause for a lot of anxiety and unintended strife between audiences and artists. 

The hope is that by focusing on culture, comparing and contrasting the differences between the acceptable and the offensive, artists can better themselves. This book will help artists of all levels create more meaningful, authentic diversity and representation. 

Back "How to Draw Black People" today and make this crucial resource for artists a reality.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Challenges for this book are mild at best. The biggest being filling out the roster of artists who will give alternate opinions on subject matter. Another challenge will be finding models and getting the correct photo reference for the purpose of this book, a process I've already begun. The scope of this project will require that outsource the shipping responsibilities to a certain degree and thus any delays in shipping rewards will be incumbent on a third party. 

However the majority of content will come from myself, the research will be done primarily by me thus making the risks minimal and majorly within my control.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I'll begin shipping immediately but the books probably won't reach you until after the holiday. The other rewards will be shipped separately. The books and shirts will come directly from the printers, the prints will come directly from me.

updates.update_userinfo: Hello everyone! Happy Black History Month!
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone, quick update. 
There was a spacing issue with the digital version I released that screwed up one or two of the pages I fixed it and I will have a link up for you all to redownload sans error. 
A bit of a goof on my part, I didn't check the file as thoroughly as I could have. 
Unfortunately, the error was also in the E-proof so I will have to do a re-order and I cannot be sure when they will be able to get the reprint done given the holiday.

campaign.story:
My Kick-Ass Graphic Novel!
64 pages of man-sized, HARDcover greatness, starring me.
New cover by Andy Smith. He draws me good.
My special promo story! It's got a dog. Sort of!
40+ pages of main story content, I kick some ass!
12-page preview story. I kick even more ass!
Sketchbook featuring images of... well, who do you think?
Sage Advice! Life tips from me, because who knows more than me?
Script-to-finished page process. You nerds like that stuff.
Cover Gallery with pretty pictures of pretty me.
Super-cool extras, like dustjackets and... stuff!
You can even get two books!
Demi-God:My Kick-Ass Graphic Novel and the Black Book: The Art of Andy Smith
Who's it all about?
You know who it's about...
  Cover Art for Demi-God:My Kick-Ass Graphic Novel
Pretty cool art by Andy Smith and Neeraj Menon, isn't it?
 The story is all about me...
We love lots o' me here at Demi-God Productions, LLC.
Interior pages tell the story, yo...
And lots more awesomeness coming from where they came from!
Fanfrickintastic Andy Smith art!
I have to share the stage...
There's a few other dudes and stuff in MY story as well, but they're mostly losers and really unimportant.
Special really cool special big covers!
These three artist dudes are drawing dustjackets for my super-cool graphic novel, 2 of them have finished drawing them and they are really cool. Even the one with a Lady Demi-God!
Check out their cool artwork, featuring me!
Awesome Ian Churchill Dustjacket Art!
  Freaky cool Bart Sears Art!
 Dude says he's working on it... a slacker in every group, right?
Fanfrickintastic Andy Smith and Mike Atiyeh Dustjacket Art!
Little comic books are cool, too. 
Just so you know, these little comics only contain about half of My Kick-Ass Graphic Novel story, and are published by IDW and Ominous Press.
Gotta have a GOAL!
Check this cool Stretch Goal graphic my awesome team made!
Fully funded, bro! Now let's stretch it!
Change my "wittle tearwy" face into a smiling, happy one by SMASHING those Stretch Goals! Be MY Hero!
You like Sketches?
Here's a sampling of the sweet head sketches Andy'll do just for you.
Fanfrickintastic Head Sketches by Andy Smith!
 Everybody needs advice.
A true hero, I enjoy being heroic and helping those less fortunate than myself, which is pretty much everybody.
Demi-God's brilliant, award-winning "SAGE ADVICE" column.
For the right amount of cash, you can send me your problem, and I'll fix it in my Sage Advice column, included in My Kick-Ass Graphic Novel. I'll even use your real name and give you a credit on the credit page. Cool, huh?
Here's where you come in... 
It's okay to make your BIG pledge now, or, I suppose you can read on if you really must.
Guys who make comics... 
Feel free to scroll right on past this next...
 Told you you wouldn't care... should'a listened.
The Art of Andy Smith!
Black Book: The Art of Andy Smith cover
                Pretty cool stuff, huh?
I'm done.
 *SHIPPING*

Shipping will be charged through our pledge manager after the Kickstarter campaign has successfully completed. We will charge backers a shipping fee based on the cost for our fulfillment partners to ship from their hubs to you. We will ship your rewards to the hubs of our fulfillment partners. From there, our partners will ship out packages to you as soon as they are received.. Please review the shipping chart below for estimates of what we expect shipping to cost. PLEASE NOTE: shipping costs may increase due to circumstances beyond our control, or via the addition of extra copies and items.
Approximate shipping amounts you should expect from our pledge manager upon completion of the campaign : 

USA: approximately $12 Canada: $12 - $15 EU: €7 - €14 Aus & NZ: $22 Asia: $35 RotW: $45
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
A portion of Demi-God: My Kick-Ass Graphic Novel is pre-funded, and as of launch about 65% of the project is complete.

Each project comes with its own unique risks and challenges, but we are in the process and on schedule for a shipping date before the end of May. Every one on Team Demi-God is working hard to make the Demi-God: My Kick-Ass Graphic Novel, and the extras included the very best they can be.

Ominous Press and the Demi-God Team understand the trust that it takes to back their work. We will do everything we can to complete and ship the project on time. However, there is always a risk that unforeseen circumstances could delay the ship date for a short time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
The Black Hand is closing! We have only a few days left for BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND Volume 2 on Kickstarter campaign! BEASTS OF THE BLACK HAND Volume 2: The Viking League is deluxe, hardcover graphic novel by the original creative team of Paul Harding, Ron Marz, and Matthew Dow Smith, an exciting horror espionage saga!
https://bit.ly/beastsoftheblackhand

Thanks to you, we were able to make the first Demi-God hardcover graphic novel a reality! Now we have the rest of the story ready to go! The Demi-God collected edition features all four issues of the mini-series, a bonus story, a complete cover gallery, and an expansive sketchbook section. Writer Ron Marz, artist Andy Smith, and colorist Michael Atiyeh have pulled out all the stops to bring the first story arc to a divine conclusion

If we reach the $7,500 funding goal, the 144-page collection will be a beautiful, comic-sized softcover. If we exceed the $15,000 goal, the entire package will be upgraded to an oversize hardcover volume!

The campaign can be found here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/dreadgods/demi-god-the-complete-series?ref=nav_search&result=project&term=Demi-God%3A%20The%20complete  Please consider a pledge to make the Demi-God collection a reality, and help us spread the word on social media!

Prepare to feast your eyes on my glory! That’s right, my kick-ass graphic novels have been shipped and should be kicking down your front doors any minute now.
I want to thank each and every one of you from the bottom of my perfectly chiselled heart (I mean it. My heart’s got abs). Your dedication means more to me than that time the Argonauts put ex-lax in Poseidon’s fishbowl. (That one still cracks me up).

updates.update_userinfo: Demi-God Graphic Novel Digital Rewards have been sent out!
updates.update_content:
Today is a glorious day, then again for me what day isn't, but it is for you all as well because the digital rewards of my Kick-ASS graphic novel have been sent out!
You can now scrap your previous ho-hum weekend plans to instead hang out with me enjoying my first adventure! 
Now go click that email and do what it says to get the most beautiful book you've laid your average human eyes on!

God-like greetings, puny mortals! My fulfillment lackeys have returned from yon comic conventions in New York City and Chicago, and are busy packing and shipping my awesome graphic novel! Your rewards should be reaching you soon, depending on where you live, as we're sending out packages in batches.
Or Demi-God, anyway! It’s real; and I'm holding it in my large, manly man hands! My first graphic novel is here, and it is sweet! Take a look at this thing of beauty...

Hello, godly backers! You should have received your Backerkit surveys by now. If you have not received your survey, please check your email's spam folder. If after that you still don't have a survey, please contact us at: info@ominouspress.com and we'll get one sorted out for you.

You must fill out a survey in order for us to ship your rewards to you. The survey is also your opportunity to add to your pledge any additional items you might want The faster we get the surveys returned, the faster we can fulfill your pledges.

Black Book: The Art of Andy Smith has been printed and is in our offices .The Demi-God hardcover graphic novel is being printed now, and all copies are expected to be received at our offices in the next week or possibly two, depending on shipping time from the printer. We will then begin fulfilling your rewards! All original art rewards by Andy Smith have been completed, and are ready to ship with your packages.

Some of you have asked about shipping charges. As stated in the Shipping section of the Kickstarter page, as well as the individual reward levels: "Shipping will be charged through our pledge manager after the Kickstarter campaign has successfully completed." Please see the Shipping section for additional details.

We're thrilled with how the books have turned out, and we think you will be too. Thank you for your continued support and patience.

updates.update_userinfo: Hey, how come I don’t get a pile of heads?
updates.update_content: Man, I look good! Muscles on muscles, just like you’d expect because ... well, I have muscles on muscles! But I am a little hurt. This Sears dude has drawn me in these huge spread images twice, and so far, no severed heads! I mean, he can’t draw that glum moron Arkon without a big 'ol pile of severed heads, but me, I don’t even get one bloody stump!

Great news my loyal followers! My Kick-Ass hardcover is off to the printer! We have received from the printer Andy Smith's, my main man and super artist, Black Book: The Art of Andy Smith. The printer did a fantastic job on it and we can't wait to get my hardcover back from the printer so you to can share in the kick-ass awesomeness of both books!

project_data.project_name: Demi-God: My Kick-Ass Graphic Novel! By Ron Marz-Andy Smith

campaign.story:
INTO THE SUCK #2
         Issue #1 was an amazing journey - Keith Thomas, the writer and creator of Into the Suck took on the yeoman's task of running the Kickstarter for issue #1 and with some nail-biting, some nerves, a little sweat, and the unbelievable response by our backers, we were fully funded in 4 days!
  Now issue #2 is finally here!  It continues the epic sci fi adventure of Ursula, (described by Keith as a super model with a frat boy personality) her glowing green companion Squee, Armando, the absconded earthling, and a cast of characters that are out of this world.  Of course, attempting to thwart her cause is the villainous Azin and his dark energy!  Why is Azin stalking our galactic gal Ursula?  What is the secret reason for collecting the bounty on Armando's head?  And how could things possibly get any worse in the area of space not-so-affectionately referred to as the Suck?
The reviews  for issue #1 were nothing short of amazing but don't just take my word for it - check out this review from AiPT: 
 http://www.adventuresinpoortaste.com/2016/07/12/into-the-suck-1-review/  
and this one from Bleeding Cool:
 https://www.bleedingcool.com/2016/07/04/ursula-stormholder-is-headed-into-the-suck/
As excited as I am to share issue #2 with all of you - it is also with a heavy heart.  My friend, Keith Thomas, the heart and soul behind Into the Suck, lost a courageous battle with cancer in October 2017.  Among his many wishes, seeing Into the Suck completed and becoming a success was a big one!  He believed wholeheartedly in what we have created!  For those of you who knew Keith - you know his incredible passion for storytelling!  For those of you who read issue 1 or may be joining the universe of The Suck for the first time with this Kickstarter - you're in for one helluva ride!
Before his departure, Keith had finished writing the entire 6 issue mini series and was able to see the first 4 issues entirely finished.  He got to see my layouts and some of the final pencil and ink art for the final two issues including the last two issues and the final three pages of the entire series!  
So this Kickstarter is about fulfilling a dream and raising enough funds to print each issue and fully complete the entire series... for all of you backers, for all of you fans of Indie comic books, for fans of creativity, for fans of Into the Suck, for friends and believers, and for Keith Thomas R.I.P.
Now (because Keith wouldn't want this to end on a somber note) please check out our book and delve deeper Into the Suck or Ursula may just smack that smirk off your face!  She's a great gal!
                                                                      --CB Zane

Risks and challenges
Right now the risks are very minimal! Issue 2 is completely finished as are issues 3 and 4. Issues 5 and 6 just need to be colored and lettered but the art and story is done. The successful funding of this project will pay for the printing of this issue, the rewards, shipping costs, and contribute to the completion of issues 5 and 6.

updates.update_content:
Hey Suckers!  
With an accidental slip of the finger - I have launched Into the Suck #3 TONIGHT! As in right NOW! It was planned for September 17th but in reviewing my campaign I clicked one button too many and... So spread the word - INTO THE SUCK 3 IS LIVE!!!!  
All the best!  
--CB Zane

As we count down to the launch of Issue 3 of Into the Suck, here is a look at Cover B by the extraordinary Tim Seeley!  It's a beautiful homage we have titled, "They mostly come out at night." Would love to here your thoughts! https://www.facebook.com/cb.zane.5

I will be posting more updates as September 17th inches closer!  You can check here... you can check your backer messages and you can check my facebook page:
https://www.facebook.com/cb.zane.5
For now... here's a peak at Cover A for issue #3!
Yes indeed!  All of the rewards and physical copies have been shipped!

Sorry for the delay in updates everyone... things have been very busy behind the scenes as I have been getting things ready so that everything coming at ya is absolutely perfect!  The latest update is that Into the Suck #2 is about to go to print!  The process will take some time but I promise to keep you all updated!  By the way,,, the pictures of DC Doll as Ursula are stunning!  And everyone will get one as one of the reward stretch goal rewards!
Hope all is well with you!

Hello all,  
I apologize that there apparently is no place to provide your e-mail address in the survey. Some of you have sent it to me directly and others have included it in the delivery notes.
For most of you, an e-mail address is included in your profile - whether or not that is the e-mail address you prefer I don't know.
So to make this as simple as possible going forward, simply include your e-mail in the delivery notes.

Hello all,
Surveys have been sent out!  Please be sure to read them and respond in order to accurately fulfill pledges.
Thanks and have a great weekend!
--CB

updates.update_userinfo: Survey, e-mail addresses and mini update
updates.update_content:
To say this month has been nerve wracking and exhilarating is the roller coaster that it was!  It's always anxiety ridden when you put your work out there in hopes that someone will recognize the effort and passion that went into a project -- be it a single piece of art, a single book or an entire series -- and respond to it with the excitement you try to use to create it from the start!
Thank you to all of you wonderful backers for believing in this series!  I hope you will be just as excited when you read it, as Keith Thomas and I were putting it together!
