campaign.story:
THANKS TO ALL OUR BACKERS FOR MAKING SPLIT EARTH SAGA COME ALIVE! WE'VE PREPARED FOR YOUR GRAPHIC NOVEL A BADGE STICKER LIMITED TO THIS CAMPAIGN !!
Split Earth Saga is a futuristic fantasy Graphic Novel. 120+ pages, fully coloured, elegantly designed. 
The writer and artists of this project have devoted 1.5 years in the creative process. This is our first attempt to reach out to an audience with our physical books.
  Long ago, in the year A.D. 2041, human civilisation had reached an ultimate state of harmony. No more energy crisis. No more poverty. No more wars. All aspects of life as people had known were reaching an ideal state. Humanity celebrated its finest moment. 
That's why no one saw it coming. 
Without warning, mountains shattered and crusts broke. Earth had split apart in two, bursting open with a planetary ring. Vast blue light emerged from the divide, mystically locking the two hemispheres in place.
Half of Earth rotated in an eerie manner, with only a limited part of its surface remaining habitable due to the precious rotation of night and day. 
The other half of Earth was not so fortunate. It stopped moving altogether, like a dead weight hovering in space, gradually turning barren under the constant glare of the sun. People named it Everlight, an expanse where menacing spectral beings “Alabaster” roamed.
Decades passed when the two hemispheres lost all contacts of each other. It was only 13 years ago that humans had found a way to breach through the strange effects of the dividing Blue Light, once again connecting two drastically different worlds.
Rescue missions were planned. Year after year, Warrior teams were dispatched to Everlight, tirelessly bringing surviving humans back to the Habitable Zone. With the aid of newly discovered mineral "Dark Stone" deep under Earth's cliffside, human warriors now stood a chance to combat Alabaster.
 A female Warrior must always travel with a male Cultivator, whose blood supply is proven compatible with her unique Dark Stone weapons. 
Zerly (code name: Sprite) is a new Warrior. Unprepared and undertrained, her volatile Dark Stone Blades only function with the nourishing blood of her stepbrother Zack.
She is far from ready, but the fate of humanity cannot wait. Now High Command is sending Sprite and three other Warriors – along with all their Cultivators – on an unprecedented mission. 
When stakes grow high and team dynamics change, they are forced to seek answers beyond those of their immediate task. In doing so, they might be confronted with the ultimate question:  
Why has Earth become what it is? 
Our artistic style aims to be the fusion of many. To combine the Western approach to power and athleticism, and the Eastern sense of aesthetics in grace and form.
The artists employ techniques ranging from European oil painting to oriental brushworks. And the fundamental design gives each Warrior a unique fighting style associated with her Dark Stone weapon type, which evolves and grows as the Warrior does.
To counter the Blue Light Zone's corroding effect that disintegrates all inorganic matters, the Warriors must cross hemispheres in capsules filled with organic algae liquid that serves both as protection and outfit. Upon landing, the algae liquid will coagulate along pre-injected tattoo lines on their skin, forming suits.
Only trained female operatives may wield Dark Stone weapons. Male Cultivators on the other hand need to release blood at will, not only for feeding the weapons but also for drawing blood seals to dispel besieging enemies. So we've designed various "Blood Release Pits" as wearables on mail Cultivators' bodies and arms. 
Fleshing out the world of Split Earth Saga - and characters that will eventually steer its fate - is such a unique experience. Our creative team loves this part of the process, and we want to share with you ideas both initiative and polished. 
Thus we have included many of our design thoughts in various Rewards, primarily in the Artbook, certain that many of you will find them interesting and engaging.  
                  Earth - now only half of it rotates against the Blue Light divide, with the other half remaining forever still. The result is the forming of new geographical zones. 
Now the surviving humans fight not only to avoid the eternal glare of the sun, but also to shun the devour of night in certain regions. A thin strap of Habitable Zone is all that’s left for life to thrive on. Or is it?
Images from the World-Setting Artbook
Old cities in regions of forever night have seen secret guilds mining Dark Stone for unfair trading, while ancient ruins in Everlight have become bases of operation for hunters of strange relics.
A long time has passed since civilisation is redefined, and now even architecture in the two hemispheres are vastly different, powered by distinct energy sources and driven by disparate threats.
  Images from the World-Setting Artbook
Further complicating the situation is the Blue Light’s mysterious effect: all inorganic matters disintegrate into dusts when travelling from the Rotating Hemisphere to the Still Hemisphere, allowing only an unidirectional escape, preventing anyone from going back to the unmoving half of Earth entirely. But scientists from the Habitable Zone have successfully built a catapult technology that is able to send trained human operatives the other way. 
Now Warriors are heading back to Everlight, to a world entirely different from their own. And through the the eyes of the young warrior Sprite, we will journey to the heart of Split Earth's mystery as fate unfolds.  
        From the onset, we knew that simply spending time in polishing the story and artworks was not enough. We must make a compelling product worthy of your hard-earned cash. Therefore we’ve done a tremendous amount of research on how best to produce a physical book that, when you finally hold it in your hands, will be VERY PROUD that you’re one of Split Earth’s founding backers. 
For the same reason, we’ve designed the Reward Tiers in a way that will echo with different Backers’ inner creative genius. Everyone will find something here that feels right for you. 
When it comes down to pricing, we set a goal that touches on breakeven. We believe this is the right decision to set the right foundation stone for the project. Given the chance, we will make alive the world of Split Earth Saga.  
This is the book. 120+ fully coloured pages, 7"x10" in size. A beautifully rendered graphic novel. Every page breathes adventure!
The above is the main reward: Split Earth Saga Graphic Novel. We have painstakingly created the artworks, now it's time to make a great book, worth as their permanent home. Open the pages and follow Sprite in her journey to the lost and forbidden part of Earth!
Other rewards - each unique in its own way - are listed here:
This elegantly designed artbook is about the world of Split Earth Saga, with the creators’ development notes. It contains characters, geography, timeline, technology, monsters, and more. You’ll also read about the artists' design philosophy.
  Deluxe hardcover set. We will produce the graphic novel and world-setting artbook with their original cover images printed on solid hard covers, wrapped in gloss black dust jackets. A classy gift set for collectors.
  Four pages of story panels (7” x 10”) selected from important scenes of the graphic novel. Annotations of the writer’s notes reveal how our own collaborative decisions were made while the written language was transformed into the visual.
  Six illustration prints (4” x 6.7”) of our signature images. At the back of each print, you will see process sketch of that very image, with the artist’ notes, laying bare their thoughts in the image design process.
   2 Kickstarter Exclusive Prints (7” x 10”) for Deluxe Combo and above. One is the signature team photo. The other is our protagonists in a teasing mood, veiled in soft light. Both are richly coloured by oil painting and oriental brushwork techniques.
  FREE BONUS for certain tiers! This is the theme music you’ve heard in the video. The MP3 comes in full version. Produced specifically for the mood, this music piece contains hand-played guitar tracks and energetically programmed music arrangement.
   All Backers' names will be credited in our website (in the order of reward tiers and pledging time).
We will also do our best to dedicate page space to the names of as many supporters as possible (when costs and production allows such). So help us spread the word!
This is the last mile. Our journey began 1.5 years ago, now all is ready except the last kick. With all your help, together we will make Split Earth Saga come alive. 
ARTWORKS BOOKLET - Add $15 to obtain
We're creating a booklet that contains at least 30 pieces of our artists' older illustrations. Some are commissioned works (with rights to release) and some are done for fun.
ROSE GOLD BOOKMARK - Add $7 to obtain
Since we've reached the $16K Stretch Goal, ALL Backers (of physical rewards) will receive a free silver metallic bookmark. Now we're offering an Add-On for those who want an additional bookmark of a different colour - Rose Gold. It's produced with an extra process of plating.
And here's the procedure to place Add-Ons
1. After you've made a Pledge to any physical reward tier, go back to the campaign page, click “Manage Your Pledge” button that shows up in the reward selection section. 
2. Increase your Pledge by your desired amount:
- If it's $15 we'll know it's for the Booklet
- If it's $7 we'll know it's for the rose gold bookmark
- If it's $22 we'll know you want both!
3. Proceed with the Continue button, and Confirm. We will be notified and will make a note under your name. When we ship the rewards, you'll get the add-ons too. :)
  Joey Yu is a storyteller by birth. Born in Taipei, grown up in Vancouver, and now relocated to Shanghai due to career pursuit, Joey has since become a published author in Asia, writing both fiction and nonfiction. His Mandarin novels have won prizes such as Kadokawa Light Novels Award and Fantasy Literature Award in Taiwan. Recently he is writing for Asian comic projects and mobile games (one of them – a FPS called Storm of Darkness – was ranked #1 in Google Play’s action-game for a brief time). 
Zephyr Z. is a character and concept designer. He specializes in elements of the imaginative, trained from years of experience in big corps that developed MMORPG. He is involved in the visual designs of various science fiction novels, including a globally acclaimed one – The Three-Body Problem by Cixin Liu – and has his painting featured in events based on the IP. Zephyr holds a Masters degree in Fine Arts. He is also an amateur archer, beating opponents in contests small and large when he isn’t drawing. 
Monica Ding is a professional artist with a diverse range of interests and influences. Most days she takes on commissioned jobs painting with two cats on her laps. She learns and appreciates different art styles, drawing from various influences and making her own. She particularly enjoys painting the female form, as to her that’s the most beautiful thing, visually. Monica also claims to be a pseudo botanist, growing cute little plants to be sold in online markets, delivered in pots painted with her own hands. 
Special Thanks to:
- Laurie Underwood for lending our video a mesmerizing voice!
- Kino Eye Productions for creating the blood-boiling music Everlight (KEP is run by Joey's former guitarist Jim; they worked together on the track)
- Leo Chang and Schafer Wilson for helps & hearty advices
- Tahan Lin for super expert tips
- Catherine Chen for her assistance in a meticulous fashion- Chris Collom for his emergency rescue AND many new friends from the KICKSTARTER community for helping a newbie creative trio get on our feet and take that first step.
A WORD ABOUT SHIPPING Just as they say - a real pain in the ass. We've researched different methods and various companies, calculating local and cross-continental costs and all that. The price gives us a headache. But we ain't gonna let distance stop us from shipping the books to whoever calls for it, wherever you may be. Everest, Antarctica. So the creative team has decided to go with our gut feeling. We are pressing shipping price down to the lowest it can be without jeopardising the goods. So even though the books are gonna come from Asia, Backers from North America and Europe should find associated shipping costs reasonable (The only risks we can't take are the heavy weights, Deluxe and double sets, so we priced those higher). We hope our honoured Backers will feel their money well spent, investing mostly in the book's production instead of delivery. And as the campaign is running its course and long after (if we hit our goal), we will continue to search for the ideal method for shipping so our Backers will be receiving smashing good Graphic Novels without overpaying.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Our creative trio do also work on side jobs in order to keep our dreams alive. While there's a risk that we might delay the completion of Split Earth due to unexpected incidents, we will absolutely do all we can to reach your expectation - and to reach our dream milestone. We've spent 1.5 years polishing this project's foundation, and we've come to Kickstarter feeling ready. So please help us spread the words of this project. Let's make it happen together.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content: We can write a book on the landmines we've stepped on during the printing and fulfilment phases (maybe we will someday, to help future Kickstarter runners to avoid pitfalls). But now things seem to be in place.
We went through a rigorous process of finding the right printer in Asia and saw through the printing process. A week back we received the physical books. Can't wait to mail them all to you!

updates.update_userinfo: First glimpse! The Packing Labor! --You'll Soon Be Getting Your Books!
updates.update_content:
Hope you're all having a fabulous winter season. A few days of holidays and we're back to work. Having committed to making 37% more contents than the original plan means a lot of subsequent adjustments—printing layout, weight, quality and economic balance, all those. We've found our printer and have sent in the source file. Let's see how the first batch of the books turns out.
And for those who don't want to wait, feel free to download the digital PDF first (plz check out the previous Backer-only Update).

The team has completed the creative content of the graphic novel, with 44 extra pages, making it 164 in total—37% more for our Backers! We believe this is the way the story deserves to be told.
We also believe our readers will have an incredible journey while reading through Split Earth Saga.

updates.update_userinfo: Happy New Year! Greetings from the Team!
updates.update_content:
3 months has passed like a breeze. We're close to the finish line in the graphical part of the production. 
We need to apologise that even the completion of the digital version is delayed for a few weeks due to unexpected things happening in our life. Rest assured we're devoting all our energy into this project and are making strong progress.
The workload is truly crazy. The original 120 pages required our undivided devotion, and then we added 44 more. LOL. Here are some previews (process sequence):

updates.update_userinfo: Milestone Update (and a quick look at the journey thus far)
updates.update_content:
We're facing a very tough decision.
Originally the plan was to build a graphic novel with 120 pages. As we turned the outline into script, and script into panel sketches, we realised that, in order to tell the story in its ideal form, we would need more pages. We thought adding 10-12 pages might make it work. But no. 
After substantial effort, tweaking and cutting in a hundred different ways, balancing time, efficiency, and economical concerns, we are now certain that......to tell this very first story of Split Earth right, ......we need another 44 pages!

updates.update_userinfo: YOUR DIGITAL GRAPHIC NOVEL—with 37% more content—Delivered!!
updates.update_content:
Split Earth writer Joey has won the Terran Award, a scholarship created by George R. R. Martin (the author of A Song of Ice and Fire, the series that the HBO show Game of Thrones is based on). It's a scholarship that helps bring one writer whose native language isn't English to the Taos Toolbox master class for science fiction and fantasy writers. 
Before Split Earth, Joey has published a few fantasy and sci-fi novels & novellas written in Mandarin. For the master class application, he self-translated parts of his works into English. And Walter Williams, another famous U.S. sci-fi writer and the organiser of the master class, picked Joey as the winner of the scholarship.
Here's what Joey said to his friends after receiving the news:

campaign.story:
STRETCH GOAL: $7000  
This will allow us to double our print run (1000 copies) as well as include a free Dream Crasher bookmark with every physical reward. We are also open to any ideas you might have for extras we could include. Just send an email to stealingfirecomics@gmail.com.
This Project  
We are collecting the first four chapters of Dream Crasher into a single printed 130+ page Volume One. After successfully Kickstarting the print edition of Chapter 1 in March 2016, we went on to self-funded small print runs of Chapters 2 & 3. We will be digitally releasing Chapter 4 with this Kickstarter and later on comiXology. With Chapter 4, our story completes the first of three major arcs. In addition we are including the digital edition of Chapter 5 with every reward tier, which will be released this coming winter.
Dream Crasher is a story about survival and creating a new world from the ashes of the old. It was also inspired by a very real experience of grief. Beneath its dystopian exterior, Dream Crasher is about finding the last bit of light in a world that's gone dark and protecting it with every fiber of our being. Even when the powers that be are stacked against us. Even when the cause seems hopeless.
Dream Crasher Volume One [Not Final Cover]
The Story
Following a bizarre cataclysmic event, a group of children struggle to survive in the world filled with angry ghosts, beasts made from human parts, and interdimensional parasites.
Excerpt from #4: Dearest, the Shadows
Our story opens with Amalie: a girl who lives alone with a strange beast she calls Creature. She doesn't know what Creature is or where he came from, but she knows that he has her Papa's eyes. The two have been working together since The Long Winter started, but everything changes one day when Creature brings home something that Amalie hasn't seen in a long time: a living human boy.
Excerpt from #1: Creature's Keeper
Praise for Dream Crasher:
"Like a nightmare dipped in a candy shell"
- Ben Beaury, GeeksOUT
“Dream Crasher is a truly unique piece of art.”
- Comicbooked.com
“The start of a fascinating new horror series.”
- PlayNicePlayNow (PN2)
“When it comes down to the action sequences… there’s truly no bounds to Olsen’s work.”
- For the Love of Indie
Excerpt from #2: The Land Vomits Ghosts
Primary Rewards
Primary Reward Tiers
*Signed Copies are price higher primarily due to the fact that Daniel and Reed live on opposite sides of the country (Brooklyn and Seattle, respectively). It's a little bit tricky to coordinate and usually means shipping those signed books twice.
--
Convention Exclusives: You need to find our table at Rose City Comic Con or Baltimore Comic Con in order to collect the full reward for this. Just show us your confirmation email.
Convention Exclusive Rewards
Unique Proofs and Original Art Rewards: As these are all unique, there is only one available for each reward level. All original artwork can be signed upon request. See below for details on the original painting commissions.
Unique Rewards - Proofs & Original Art
FOR ORIGINAL PAINTING COMMISSIONS - There is no limit on the number of backers. Commissions can be any size up to 11x17 on heavy weight paper. Your choice of Watercolor, Acrylic, or simply pen and ink. Any questions, just message us: stealingfirecomics@gmail.com.
For a large scale preview of the posters and original art, please scroll down to the Posters & Original Art section.
Our Story:
We (Daniel and Reed) have been friends since High School, and first had the idea to make Dream Crasher back in 2010. It took years of careful planning and perseverance to complete the first chapter, which was published digitally in June 2015. Despite numerous personal and creative setbacks along the way, we have created something we are incredibly proud of. We have been sharing our story with the world one convention at a time. This next step will allow us to enter the graphic novel market while we continue publishing 2 chapters a year until we're finished.
Reed and Dan at Saratoga Comic Con
In My Own Words: Daniel
In the summer of 2011, Reed and I were on track for releasing Chapter 1 in early 2012. The first chapter was drawn and painted and the second chapter had been started. We still hadn’t thought about lettering, logos, or print budgets - but we had momentum. Then everything came to a screeching halt when my boyfriend died.  
The unexpected trauma, the weight of the grief, and the subsequent depression and healing all took their toll in various ways. It was more than 6 months before I was able to return to the project again, and it would be another year before I finished the next chapter. This was in no small part because I gained a whole new perspective on what I was making happen to Amalie.   I was following Kurt Vonnegut’s sixth rule to a T. I was being a sadist and making awful things happen to my main character, but I hadn’t given a second thought to how it was affecting her. I hadn’t thought about how she processed the world around her, or who she was because of it. Through my own grief, I understood her on a whole new level. In many ways, Amalie is a representation of how strong I wish I could be. She’s a survivor, but she makes it look easier than I know it to be.
Dan working on the Chapter 1 Lettering
 While Dream Crasher is a bleak dystopian tale on it's surface, I began to think of this new world less like a graveyard and more like fertile soil. It’s not a story about the world that’s been destroyed. It’s about the new world taking root in its place. It’s about the children who have an opportunity to shape it. Beyond the horror of the present, there is hope. There is a future worth fighting for.  
Ultimately Reed and I made the decision to completely redo the artwork for Chapter 1. It set us even further back, but I can confidently say that we have a better comic because of it. Reed’s patience, understanding, and empathy throughout this project has been instrumental in my sticking with it. There were plenty of opportunities to give up quietly and walk away, and yet we stuck with it. I can’t thank him enough for that. We’re still pushing on, and I believe now more than ever we will see it through to the end.  
Excerpt from #4: Dearest, the Shadows
In My Own Words: Reed  The Dream Crasher story, and Chapter 1 in particular for me, personally represent that relentless monastic fortitude that I have continuously needed to be happy and achieve what I have so far in my life. It is about recognizing the excuses for not drawing after a long day of biking to work and packing CSA boxes with your best friend, but knowing that an excuse does not ink a page, and that I can always sleep later. I hope you enjoy what we have here, it is just the tip of one colossal nightmarish iceberg.
Reed working on the Chapter 1 Prototype
 Our Budget
Goal: $4500
This will cover a full print run of 500 copies plus the production costs of making the book (lettering the fourth chapter,* book design, copyediting, and commissioning original art) and shipping rewards to our backers.
*Lettering costs for Chapter 1-3 were covered by our first Kickstarter.
Creature tours the New York City subway.
Stretch Goal: $7000
This will allow us to double our print run (1000 copies) as well as include a free Dream Crasher bookmark with every physical reward.
We will unveil further stretch goals upon making this one, but the possibilities include: funding the production of Volume 2, original sketch cards for backers $35 and higher, Stealing Fire t-shirts, and even a hardcover edition. We may even ask you (backers and potential backers) what you would most like to see. But in the meantime we'll try not to get too far ahead of ourselves.
Excerpt from #3 Welcome Home
Posters & Original Prints
Keep in mind some available as both posters and original paintings, some are available as only one or the other.

Signed Original Proofs
Chapter 2 - Original Proof Copy.
Distinguishing characteristics: Internal pages darker than final copies, missing Keness logo on the back.
Chapter 2: The Land Vomits Ghosts
Chapter 3 - Original Proof Copy. Distinguishing characteristics: Back inside cover has a while line from an empty text block we forgot to remove.
Chapter 3: Welcome Home
Volume 1 - Original Proof Copy
Distinguishing characteristics: It's not made yet so we can't promise any distinctive mistakes. We do our best to get everything right the first time. That being said, the probability is that we won't get it perfect with the first try.
Dream Crasher: Volume One
Music by Danny Zenith
The music you hear playing in the background of our video was made by none other than Danny Zenith. If you dig it, he's releasing while we are running this campaign. You check out more of his music on soundcloud.
Stealing Fire Comics
Stealing Fire Comics
Stealing Fire is a name derived from the myth of Prometheus and his act of bringing fire to humankind. It is a metaphor for taking what is needed but not given; for challenging the power dynamics of our present and envisioning new ways forward. It's about eating from the tree of knowledge even though it is forbidden; accepting that banishment from paradise is more honorable than ignorance. We're writing with pictures and drawing with words to rattle the cage of a complacent world.
The imprint Stealing Fire Comics was created to launch Dream Crasher in 2015. It was always intended to be a vehicle for multiple creative endeavors, and 2018 will be a year for such things. The first of these was Soulless Golem (Stealing Fire #1), which is available now in our gumroad store. 
Excerpt from Soulless Golem
Souless Golem is the first of an annual zine series (Stealing Fire #1, if you will). The Soulless Golem drawings began after white supremacist Richard Spencer gave a speech likening non white humans to soulless golems. Drawing on Judaic mysticism and witchcraft, as means of us collectively conjuring a force (golem in this case) to fight back against oppression. The drawings are in direct respond to the Trump administration and the rise of hate as mainstream.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter. All of the artwork has been completed for the story. All that's left to be done is the book design itself, which we already have scheduled.

We are doing a print run of 500 (1000 if we hit our stretch goal). By doing a small print run we are able to work within a more reasonable budget, but run the risk of the full amount being a bit small after rewards are distributed.

We are also shipping heavier books this year. We have less rewards than last time, so the process should be a lot simpler after we send the surveys out. Getting everything packaged and weather proofed while being economical can be a challenge in itself, but we are prepared and already have most of the materials.

Although the book is longer, the parts are almost the same as our last Kickstarter, and we were successful. There are stil plenty of challenges, but we have a road map and past experience to guide us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Check out Reed's new project Mink Cage
updates.update_content: Dream Crasher artist extraordinaire Reed Olsen has a new project running on Kickstarter. If you are fan of his watercolor artwork, a fan of cycling, or an environmentally conscious human who enjoys a good narrative, take a moment to check out the Mink Cage Kickstarter. He just hit the 75% mark and has just under a week left to make his goal.

updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone
I just wanted to send out a quick email to give 2 major updates:
Chapter 5 of Dream Crasher is almost finished! It will be coming out digitally in the next few weeks. We'll be running a few different promo deals during the release week, so be on the lookout.

updates.update_userinfo: Chapter 5 is Coming + A New Anthology
updates.update_content:
This is just a quick update to let you all know that:
All physical rewards have shipped. 
All digital rewards have been sent out - with the exception of those of you getting a digital copy of Chapter 5 - that will be out in December.
If your copy does not arrive in the next few weeks, please send an email to and we will get a new copy in the mail.

Dear All,
Here's a west coast update from Reed:
This past weekend I tabled a small press expo at the Fantagraphics Bookstore in Georgetown, Seattle. The free drinks, music, grilling, and a very real heat wave made for an eventful day. I tabled with My buddy D.W. whom I met last year at this event. It was a great way to celebrate our friend anniversary. This was also the first comic event where I brought everything via bicycle. Weather depending, it is my goal to cycle to Jet City Comic Con in Tacoma this Fall.

...and that means your rewards will be gathered, packaged, and sent within the next few weeks. The first batch will go to Seattle, where Reed will sign a whole bunch, and then ship them to New York. I'm already gathering the surveys and figuring out the packaging and posting. If you haven't filled out the survey yet... now is your last chance.
This process has taken longer than anticipated, and so I'd like to thank each one of you for your continued patience. The extra time we took was spent getting Dream Crasher Volume One to be the best we could possibly make it. The book will include a beautiful design by Sean Sass, a wonderful Forward written by the talented , and an Afterward that tells the origin of Amalie's name. There were a lot of unplanned setbacks and learning experiences in putting it all together, but the book came out better for it. I can't wait for you all to have them.

Dear All,                                                                                                                                Many seasons have passed through these correspondents. As Spring arrives, it feels like a holiday in my corner of Seattle. All the good things seem to often come a once. Much like riding up a mountain, I am feeling the joy of delayed gratification. I am holding a demo copy of DC Vol One in my hands. 
   Feeling the mass of this book in my palms us like a deep exhale. We are running through it to catch any last minute adjustments. Daniels has been doing most of the work.  We are so close to shipping rewards time. Thank you all for sticking it through with us. Assembling this book has been a mountain of work. I would like to take this moment to deeply thank and congratulate our book designer and my friend, Sean Sass. He has been so patient with us at making all the changes needed. This book looks SO good!!! Along with the book Daniel's friend made a kick-ass Dream Crasher engraving which makes us look so pro!

campaign.story:
$16,000 STRETCH GOAL REACHED!! STRETCH GOAL #2 - $18,000!
DIGITAL PACKAGE DEAL
Cubicles #1 by Walter Ostlie 
 Zulu #1 by Alverne Ball 
 Shiver Bureau #1 by Walter Ostlie 
 Barrdok the Wanderer #1 by Mike Priebe 
DayBlack #1 by Keef Cross 
 Kid Code: Channel Zero #1 by John Jennings, Stacey Robinson and Damian Duffy 
 Voodoo Detective: Midnight Offering by R. Thomas Favino, Dominic Black, and Laura Lee 
 Bounce! by Chuck Collins 
 Aceblade #1 by Danny J Quick, Christopher Hollars, and Vhon Remot 
Princess LovePon #1 by Shauna J. Grant 
 Malice in Ovenland #1 by Micheline Hess 
 Mythworlde Magazine by Gerald Boney 
 Tribal Quest (from Humanescent anthology) by Jacques E Nyemb, Derick Jones, and Justin Wood 
 The Stronger by Chris Ward, Samir Simão, and Keithan Jones 
So not only do you get copies of Is'nana the Were-Spider Vol 2, but your rewards and 14 free digital comics if we get to the $18,000! Tell a friend or two!
GOAL REACHED!! STRETCH GOAL #1 NEXT - $16,000!!
THE CROSSOVER EVENT!! 
Stretch Goal Crossover Event by Vol 1's Walter Ostlie!
Given that my character Is’nana and his father, Anansi the Spider, have been established with the ability to travel through different worlds, I thought it’d be fun to take advantage of this and introduce people to different books and series in the indie comic world. With the stretch goal of $16,000, the Is’nana team are hoping to raise enough money to add 40 extra pages of story content to allow Is’nana to go through these different worlds, each illustrated by their respective creators. The goal is to raise enough money to pay all the artists/creators involved.
So we have Vol 1's artist Walter Ostlie's Shiver Bureau, Micheline Hess' Malice in Ovenland, Shauna J. Grant's Princess LovePon, Chuck DragonBlack Collins' Bounce!, Keef Cross' DayBlack, Mike Priebe's Barrdok the Wanderer, and N Steven Harris' and Robert Garrett's Ajala! I thought it'd be great to do a sort of cross promotion between each creator and books and given that I have a good set of readers and fanbases, I'm hoping I can not only introduce readers to more Black folklore and mythological characters, but also get more people into other indie books and franchises. If anyone is able to jump in to help, that'd be wonderful, or even spreading the word and discussing what the mission goal is! So please pledge today and spread the word!
THE STORY
A horror-fantasy, coming of age story, Is'nana the Were-Spider: The Hornet's Web is the second part to an on-going series of one-shots/graphic novels.
Is'nana the Were-Spider, Vol 2 Cover
Accidentally breaking a barrier between our world and theirs (called THE MOTHER KINGDOM), Is'nana (the son of Anansi the Spider God of Stories) accepts the responsibility for releasing creatures of horror into our reality, villains who want nothing more but to cause chaos and mayhem to achieve their own diabolical or selfish goals. With guidance from his father, Is'nana not only strives to live up to his father's name but to also reach his own potential while he seeks to discover his individuality and place in the world.
 After defeating Osebo the Leopard, Is'nana must now face Queen Mmboro, her daughter Princess Kantite, and their family of hornets, wasps, and bees who unite and seek to inject themselves into human beings and take over our reality. 
Queen Mmboro and her Harvest
  Attack of the Killer Were-Bees
 Unfortunatley caught amongst the mayhem is the Baptiste family, Leland, Gina, and Jenka, who fight to survive and protect each other at all cost against Queen Mmboro's evil hive...
The Baptiste Family
 ...while Is'nana must not only test his physically limits but also deal with rising tensions with his father who sees fit to control and protect his every move.
Tension between Father and Son
Be sure to Like and Follow the Facebook Page. 
THE MISSION
Last year since the success of the Kickstarter for Vol. 1 of Is'nana the Were-Spider and following the official publication release, the book has been met with acclaim, new fans, and supporters. Fans of Anansi the Spider were welcomed with a modern take on the old mythological folklore of West Africa and the Caribbean, while new fans were introduced to rich characters from old (and sometimes forgotten) stories. Just as the last volume, I hope to continue to make sure these characters and stories are not being forgotten, as Is'nana pushes forth to continue on the legacy of Africana and Black-based folklore and mythology. Your support, donations, while sharing this project through friends, family, and social media will help to further continue this mission.
Anansi the Spider and Papa Legba of Haitian Stories
I am hoping to use the funds raised to print copies of not only Vol 2, but reprints of Vol 1 that is currently sold out. This Kickstarter will also allow new readers to pledge for a copy of Volume 1 and catch up with the mission. 
Vol 1 (currently sold out) and Vol 2
 WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?
Just like last year, the production of the book from pencils, inks, colors, and lettering are being paid out of pocket. We are currently almost half way through the coloring stages and will begin lettering soon. Money raised will go to final production and printing physical copies of Vol 2 and reprints of Vol 1 (currently sold out) for backers, stores/retailers, libraries, and conventions. Money will also be going into merchandise, rewards, shipping, and Kickstarter fees.
THE TEAM
Gregory Anderson-Elysee is the writer and creator of Is'nana: The Were-Spider. On pencils and inks is Daryl Toh (Outer God), with Lee Milewski (Hunter's Lore) providing colors, Joshua Cozine (The Untamed) on letters and production, and last but not least Walt Msonza Barna on the covers!
 REWARDS
            Daryl Toh (Vol 2 artist)
  Chris Giarusso (G-Man, Mini Marvels)
  Miguel Blanco (OogeeMan)
  Line work by Levi Fari-Raqub / Colors by Leonard Anderson
  Chris Koehler (Legend)
              Greg Anderson-Elysee (Is'nana Writer/Creator)
  Scott Bratek
   +Add $50 to Original Pin Up Print Pledge for ALL 7 Pin Ups
       - Anansi the Spider
- Is'nana the Were-Spider 
- Is'nana the Were-Spider (Spider Form) 
- Papa Legba, Loa God of the Crossroads
 - Queen Mmboro 
- Osebo the Leopard
- Kantite, daughter of Queen Mmboro 
    (Add $15 to original Pins pledge for all 7 Pins)
               4 T-shirts to Choose From
                 -  Change Pledge $70 (instead of $50) for 2 different Is'nana T-shirts, or $100 for all 4 T shirts.
  Custom Is'nana Funko Pop Vinyl Toy
    3 of 28 Original Pages from Is'nana Vol 1
     Add Ons and Prices
If you wish to add in an extra reward to your pledge, read below for the prices of the Add On which you will put in addition to your pledge. Please note that Add Ons will not be included in the PDF reward tiers unless a physical copy is pledged.
   ALSO!! VERY IMPORTANT:: BE SURE TO SEND ME A MESSAGE TO CONFIRM YOUR ADD ON TO YOUR PLEDGE!!!
_______________________________________________________________
ALSO... STRETCH GOAL!! $16,000
If the initial goal is exceeded into the next goal (16,000), an added 40 pages of story will be included in the book for no extra charge. The art will be drawn by Vol 1's artist Walter Ostlie (Shiver Bureau).
The story will follow Is'nana on a mission from Papa Legba, the Haitian Loa God of the Crossroads, to find his dog who's gone missing due to Is'nana breaking the barrier between worlds in Vol 1. Unfortunately, other trickster characters from Haitian folklore, Ti-Malice, Bouki, and Kompere Chat have other plans for Legba's dog. Also entangled with his own motive is Jeremy Tableau, a trickster guided by Legba himself, there to ensure Is'nana's quest is not an easy one...
The Black Sheep, Jeremy Tableau (stretch goal character)
 The story will also feature crossovers and interactions with characters from  other indie comic book properties like Shiver Bureau by Walter Ostlie, Bounce! the Comic by Chuck Collins, Malice in Ovenland by Micheline Hess, DayBlack by Keef Cross, Barrdok the Wanderer by Mike Priebe, Princess LovePon by Shauna J. Grant, and Ajala: A Series of Adventures by N Steven Harris.
Behind the Scenes, Princess LovePon, Is'nana and Jeremy are preparing for the Kickstarter!
  Hanging out with the cast of Shiver Bureau!
  Anansi makes a surprise guest visit in Malice in Ovenland set
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The last Kickstarter (Vol 1) was successful and backers received their books and rewards were fulfilled. I am expecting Vol 2 book to be fully completed before the end of the year, but added time was added in case of any unexpected delay. Although Vol 2 is already currently being funded, the added pages, if we achieve the stretch goals, may add to a longer wait time for the book due to not just the pages from Ostlie, but also the pages from the guest creators and their properties. I still aim to release the book well ahead of the listed expected date.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Hello, everyone. We were able to get to $14K this past weekend and  over 400 Backers! Thank you for believing in this project. The team and I  feel blessed for all the love and support.
Given we have yet to announce a stretch goal, I can announce that I'll be giving away a free Is'nana the Were-Spider sticker to every  physical backer. This was designed by our very on Angael Davis-Cooper,  the colorist of Showtime! I hope you all love it as much as I do!

Is’nana the Were-Spider: Showtime is getting published and printed!!!  Thanks to all of you for the continued support and believing in this  project. While we've funded in 3 days, we still got 19 days left! So if you've yet to jump on board, definitely jump on! I am currently working on the possible stretch goal, which it seems like will be an Is'nana PDF e-comic! So definitely be sure to get in the loop with backing Showtime to get updates on helping to make it happen.

updates.update_userinfo: First 2 AWESOME Days!! Thank you!! Video Preview!
updates.update_content:
WOW!!! We made past $8,000 of our $10,000 goal within the first two days of the campaign!! I am beyond grateful for everyone coming on board on this journey with me and the Is'nana team. This book has been a long time coming and we want to thank you from the bottom of our hearts for believing in us and supporting us bring this book to life and hopefully into your hands and screens!
We still have a little bit of a way to go but we are inching ever so close. But we'll get there! Please be sure to check out the Kickstarter video below and jump on board to the campaign, share with anyone you know who may be interested in our merry little spider as he explores city dance life!

Hello, everyone! The campaign for Is'nana the Were-Spider: Showtime, is finally LIVE!! Art by Miguel Blanco, Angael Davis-Cooper, Deron Bennett, David Brame, and finally the cover reveal by Khary Randolph!!
Is'nana  the Were-Spider finds himself squared up against his next challenge:  breaking dancing in the streets of New York City! Showtime
CLICK HERE TO SUPPORT SHOWTIME!!

updates.update_userinfo: Monday! New Is'nana the Were-Spider Kickstarter Campaign! It's Showtime!
updates.update_content:
Hello, everyone! Despite the last few months of madness that we have all been going through, I hope things are well. My heart goes out to everyone who has been dealing with any type of hardship. I've been using a lot of this time to keep myself busy and have also been working on the next Is'nana the Were-Spider one shot. A 64 page comic, Is'nana  the Were-Spider finds himself squared up against his next challenge:  breaking dancing in the streets of New York City! It's Showtime!
Launching this coming Monday, August 31st. Joining the team is Miguel Blanco on pencils and inks, Angael Davis-Cooper on colors, Deron Bennett/AndWorld on letters, and a short story by David Brame.

updates.update_content:
We're in the last day of the Modern Mythology: The Heroes' Journey Kickstarter campaign and as of this update we need less than $1000 to reach our funding goal!
This new anthology includes the most recent Is'nana the Were-Spider story which was created for this book and I think you guys will love it! So if you haven't had the opportunity yet, please check it out and jump on board! Mine will be one of many great modern adaptions of myths from all over the world, so if you're into myths or folklore, it's right up your alley!

updates.update_userinfo: New Is'nana Story + New Niobe from Stranger Comics!!
updates.update_content: First I want to thank everyone who have been able to jump on board to the new anthology on Kickstarter, Modern Mythology: The Hero's Journey! This book includes the next Is'nana the Were-Spider story, which was created for this book. It was based on a West African proverb and a story I stumbled on and it's one I'm very proud of. I was able to reconnect with David Brame and Deron Bennett on this piece and I think we have another winner. So many pages I want to share but am afraid of spoilers! I'm one who loves surprises!

campaign.story:
The Indies: An Animated Short is not affiliated, associated, authorized, endorsed by, or in any way connected with The Indies or any of its subsidiaries or its affiliates.

Keep up with The Indies: An Animated Short
 WE DID IT!!!
We successfully reached our goal and got The Indies: An Animated Short fully funded!  There's still a lot of work to be done, but this is a big first step.  If you want to stay up to date with us and the project, then be sure to follow us on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter.  You can also visit Bluegeekmusic.com for more info.  Thank you so much for all of your support.  Without you, none of this is possible.  I can't wait to show you what we come up with!
--DJ Tony Drake
   The Indies: An Animated Series is a project that I've been working on for the past 5-6 years.  I saw that there really wasn't an animation that spoke directly to the Hip-Hop community without trying to exploit the culture.  We've had Hip-Hop animations that we all love like Afro Samurai, The Boondocks, and Samurai Champloo.  But we haven't had anything on that scale and that GOOD in a very long time.  Fast forward to today and we're now trying to continue that legacy of dope Hip-Hop centered animation by filling that void with The Indies: An Animated Series.  With a dope storyline, great art, and all original Hip-Hop score I truly believe we can accomplish that.  We've been pitching the full length series and showing our work at Comic Cons which has allowed us to gain a lot of positive traction.     
We wanted to take advantage of that momentum, so we decided to start a Kickstarter to raise funds to create an animated short!  This action packed short will give viewers a chance to get to know all five main characters, along with hearing some of the music from our original soundtrack.
You want to know what the story is about?  Well check it out below:
Set in a futuristic dystopian society, The Indies: An Animated Series follows an up and coming rapper named Slick. Born into a well-to-do family living on Earth's Moon, he longs for the opportunity to pursue his dream of becoming a famous recording artist. With a burning desire to make his dreams come true by any means necessary, Slick has a chance meeting with DJ Chops, one of Hip-Hop's biggest DJs and record executives. Chops offer Slick what seems to be an amazing recording contract, which Slick hastily signs without reading the fine print. Slick soon finds out that not only did he sign up to pursue his dream of being a famous artist, but he also signed up for something much more sinister. You see, what Slick failed to realize is that not only are record labels home to some of the universe’s biggest music stars; they also serve as fronts for hitmen for hire services of nefarious crime lords. In order to free himself from his contract, Slick must now work with his new label mates to release his debut album while simultaneously executing dangerous hit jobs. Through these missions, the label mates will explore morality, loyalty, human nature, and discover who they really are at their core.
    Peep the five main characters from The Indies.
  We have five main characters in our story, but music is arguably the sixth. It will be an integral part of moving the action forward and setting the mood in this animated short. Since the music is so important we had to call in the best! That's why we decided to record our soundtrack at the Grammy award winning House Studios DC. The producers we've worked with are amazing and have production credits that include Pimp C, Skepta, Wale, Three Six Mafia, Kodak Black, A$AP Rocky, Fabolous, and Wiz Khalifa. Take a look below at some BTS footage of us in the studio creating the music:
  We wanted to create the world that was futuristic, but also very familiar to people. With that in mind, Tony sat down with our concept artist, Jonathan Powell, and was able to explore what the world would look like once people started living on the moon and neglecting the Earth.  Below is a sample of what they came up with:
  Why we need your help as told by the creator of The Indies: An Animated Series, DJ Tony Drake:
So far this project has been funded 100% by the money I get from my day job as an Electrical Engineer. Everything from studio time, musicians, concept art, comic con travel/setup, etc. I think I've been able to accomplish a lot, but in order for me to take The Indies: An Animated Series to the next level and get this project the attention it deserves, I need your help. We've been pitching The Indies: An Animated Series to investors and executives, and although they love the story and art, they want to know if there's an audience for this. To me, it's a no brainer. But if we can fully fund this project, not only will we get a dope short, but we can prove to the executives that all of us want to see The Indies: An Animated Series on television!
Pan 5-inch Vinyl Toy
    Most Kickstarters ask for you to donate and then you have to wait until the campaign is over to see if you'll receive anything.  We don't want to do that.  So instead we'll be releasing a free webcomic written by DJ Tony Drake and illustrated by the super talented Icky H.  Each week we will release a couple of panels to tell a story that will conclude at the end of the Kickstarter campaign.  This is our way of saying thank you for supporting us!  You can read it here.
The Indies: A Webcomic
        All the funding we receive will be going towards the animation and delivery of rewards. Everything you see here has been funded by DJ Tony Drake, but none of this money will go into his personal pockets. Outside of fees and Kickstarter reward fulfillment, the money will solely be used for artists and creatives that are contributing towards this Kickstarter. If we are able to exceed our goal, those additional funds will also go towards improving the quality of the animation.
    Major Contributors
There have been many people who have contributed to this project, but I want to take the time to thank all of these people below.  Without them, this project wouldn't be as dope as it is:
Artella
Braeonart
Brandon Carlye
Brands By Bry
DK aka Wayne Watts
House Studios DC
Icky H.
Ike da Kid
Jake Vicious
Johnathan Powell
King Soma
Kokayi
Lil Awree
Locke Kaushal
Native
Niko Del Yato
PNMA
Ra The MC
Reggie Volume
Stereo Champions
The 3D Hero
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Because you are entrusting us with your support and donations, we want to ensure you that we are 100% committed to bringing this project to completion. With any project, there are going to be risks and challenges, but we will always strive to make sure we're doing everything we can to deliver a high-quality product that you can enjoy. On top of being an Electrical Engineer, Tony Drake also has a Master's degree in Program Management and has a lot experience in dealing with large budgets and complex projects. He plans to use those experiences and connections in the entertainment industry to ensure that this project comes to completion.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone,
During the past nine months that The Indies: An Animated Short has been available, I've been doing a ton of BTS work talking to studios and entering the film into festivals.  It's always been well received and as most of you know, been winning multiple awards (which is crazy!!!).  It's been so well received that now I can share some incredible news with all of you....

Hey Everyone!
Just wanted to send out a quick update to let everyone know that we're still at it.  Not only have we been participating in film festivals and comic conventions, but now we're starting to win awards!  Shoutout to all the crew for working so hard on this animation.  And thank you to each and every one of you for believing in the vision and supporting us.  These are your awards as much as they are ours.  There's a lot more to come, so make sure you're following everything on Instagram and Facebook.  Thanks again for everything!
-DJ Tony Drake

updates.update_userinfo: New Indies Merch and Phoenix Film Festival Updates
updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone,
I try to not flood your inbox with a lot of updates, but things are really picking up for The Indies.  The first thing is that we have some new merch for sale on our website!  You can now order T-shirts and posters over at https://bluegeekmusic.com/shop.  The shirts are the same ones that our crew has been wearing to all of the screenings.
I'm also happy to say that we have multiple screenings across the United States over the next couple of months.  The Indies: An Animated Short is being shown with a bunch of other great films, so if you're in the area on these dates you should definitely come out:

Hey Everyone!
Hope 2019 is treating you well.  The Indies: An Animated Short is officially out in the world and it's been doing great so far!  Not only has the short been getting a good response online, but it's also being well received on the film festival circuit.  The short has only been out for two months and we've already been able to screen the film in DC, California, and North Carolina.  And after this upcoming weekend (24-27 January) we can add Texas to the list of states because we'll be screening the film at the Denton Black Film Festival in Denton, TX.  I'll be traveling to Texas to do a Q&A at the film festival, so if you're in the area be sure to come out.  You can purchase your tickets .

We did it ya'll!!!  The release day for The Indies: An Animated Short is finally here.  Thank you so much for choosing to be a part of this journey with us.  You can now watch the short at https://youtu.be/ykwgAiHq4PI and purchase/stream the lead single Trouble at the following locations:
iTunes
Spotify
Apple Music

Words can't express how excited I am right now, so I'm just going to keep it short.  Two announcements:
1. November 8th, 2018 there will be a private advanced screening of The Indies: An Animated Short in Washington, DC.  This is huge because it's actually being shown in a real theater!!!  On the same day, the backers that received an HD download will receive a special link to download the short.

Hey Everyone,
I wanted to send out a quick update to let everyone know that we've been accepted to our first film festival!!! On November 3rd, we'll be in Charlotte, NC competing in the Geek Short Film Festival. If you're in the area, you should definitely hit it up. As more film festival announcements come in, I'll be sure to keep you updated.
Also, the first teaser for The Indies: An Animated Short has been released online. It's been getting a good response, so be sure to check it out below. Please feel free to share the link with your friends and family, and let them know that the announcement for the release date is coming soon! https://vimeo.com/289986826

campaign.story:
THE STORY
Welcome to the world of Scissor Sisters, a fantastical reality where the time stream is a living and well-traveled path between wheres and whens. We think you'll like it here, and we'd love for you to stay, check the place out and help us fund printing of this massive, sweeping story. 
Last Summer, with the help of 102 generous Backers, we successfully funded Scissor Sisters, a 120-page graphic novel - the story of Candi and Ash, a pair of women separated by millennia but whose love is an inevitability. They are thrown together in the least likely of times and places and hunted by The Continuum, a cross-time conspiracy of the elite and the sinister deeply frightened of the destiny of the couple they refer to as The Sisters.
The Original Scissor Sisters Graphic Novel - Available in a Bundle with Swan Song at the $25 Reward Tier!
We loved it so much – and got so much terrific feedback on it – that we decided to continue the story in the 54-page graphic novel, Scissor Sisters: Swan Song. This new volume follows the time-tripping assassin Cygnet, vanquished by the Sisters to ancient times in our first chapter, her only ally a friend of one of the Sisters. Faced with traitors to her wicked Master, Cygnet must steal a powerful mask to repair her time-traveling armor and resume her quest to fulfill her mission and destroy the Sisters.
THE PROJECT
The Star of the Show - Scissor Sisters: Swan Song!
Scissor Sisters: Swan Song is written by Kevin LaPorte (Vicious Circus, Last Ride for Horsemen, Roadkill du Jour, Scales of Time, and The Absentee) and illustrated by Marvel and DC veteran Rich Perotta (Scales of Time, The Ray, Deadpool) with colors by Vito Potenza. Scissor Sisters  was co-created by Erica J. Heflin (Zenescope's Wonderland, Cosmic Times' Flesh of White, and Antithesis). Consider it rated PG-13 for violence/gore and adult themes.
This is the second of several planned volumes of Scissor Sisters, all with the same committed team of creators, and our plans go far beyond crowdfunding, to include broad distribution through comic shops and other retail channels! But, first, we have to pay for the initial print run, which is the purpose of this Kickstarter campaign and where you come in!
THE PREVIEW
Cygnet stalks her prey...
  ...and manipulates the very hands of time to secure her enemies...
  ...frozen in the numbers of her clock, they fall...
  ...her assassin's skills unveiled, she tightens her temporary alliance...
CHARACTERS
  THE CREATORS
Writer - Kevin LaPorte
Fairhope, Alabama-based writer and co-creator of genre comics with a horror bent, the worlds Kevin creates range from the bayou territory of a lone motorcycle gangster seeking vengeance for his cursed appetite for street meat and the slaughter of his brothers-in-arms (Roadkill du Jour) to dark carnivals overrun by killer clowns violently avenging abused children (Vicious Circus) to dying frontier towns in the Old West beset by Steampunk versions of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse (Last Ride for Horsemen) to hellish dimensions replete with untapped energy mined by unsuspecting adventurers ripe for demonic possession (The Absentee)!
Artist - Rich Perotta
Starting as an intern for the X-Men office in 1993, Rich soon became a staff artist and then a freelance inker for Marvel with a dash of Dark Horse and Crusade Entertainment thrown in for good measure. Rich inked for Marvel for roughly ten years. In 2004, he took a break from comics and in 2010, re-entered the comic industry working for DC Comics inking titles Booster Gold and The Ray limited series. Rich is now pencilling and inking independent titles such as Mice & Man, Magma-Man for Source Point Press and the Scales of Time one-shot and Scissor Sisters series for INVERSE PRESS. Rich currently resides in New York City.
Colorist - Vito Potenza
Born in Mola di Bari (BA) – Italy in 1983, Vito attended and graduated at International School of Comics – Rome [2005-2008] and subsequently worked as illustrator/comics artist for The First Place and Edizioni Master [2005-2012]. He then moved on to be illustrator and storyboard artist for Video Explainers [2013-today] and has worked from July 2016 as colorist for Inverse Press.
THE KICKSTARTER PEDIGREE
We have led TWENTY-FIVE previous, successful Kickstarter campaigns for comic projects! We are experienced and reliable creators and purveyors of comics via Kickstarter. You will get what you pledge for and get it quickly.
REWARDS
    Available Via Various Reward Tiers
             STRETCH GOALS
Once we reach our initial funding goal of $3000, we can offer additional FREE rewards as we hit higher benchmarks, beginning with...
$3500 - ALL (non-PDF) Backers receive a 3" x 3" die-cut Scissor Sisters decal featuring Cygnet!
Yours FREE & Automatically when campaign funding reaches $3500!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are few to NO risks in the completion and fulfillment of this project. As the Kickstarter campaign launches, ALL pages are complete in terms of line art, with only some coloring and lettering remaining. We are committed to having ALL production work completed within two months of the end of the Kickstarter campaign, so printing and fulfillment may be accomplished by November, 2016 at latest.

Printer delays are obviously beyond our control, but we are working with a high-end, reliable company that we are confident will deliver within the prescribed timeframe for fulfillment.

Our first obligation is to you, the BACKER. Given your support and trust in us, we aim to have the creative aspect of the project COMPLETE before there is even funding in hand, to ensure you get what you paid for at the highest possible level and within the shortest possible timeframe!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfillment Update - All Items Are Full Go!
updates.update_content: The last of the signed and sketched Swan Song rewards have arrived at Inverse Press HQ! That means ALL remaining rewards will ship by Tuesday of this week! Check out Rich Perotta's remarqued interiors, coming SOON to the backers who selected them:

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfillment Update + Scissor Sisters on ComiXology!
updates.update_content:
Print copies of Scissor Sisters: Swan Song have arrived and will begin shipping to all backers THIS WEEK! Although the holidays slowed things down some, we are only a few weeks later than we'd hoped to get these books in your hands!
Today marks a banner occasion for Scissor Sisters, as the full, 120-page graphic novel that started it all is now available on ComiXology.com and is presented in their cinematic, Guided-View format! It's a totally new way to experience our story, in the finest digital format available!

Vito Potenza has finished coloring the last pages of Scissor Sisters: Swan Song, and it is going to Weston Design Studio for letters today! We hope to have it back and ready to go to print within a couple of weeks, so we are almost home with this story.
CAN'T WAIT TO SHOW IT TO YOU!

updates.update_userinfo: Digital Links for Scissor Sisters & Scales of Time!
updates.update_content:
It came down to the last minute, but WE DID IT!
Thanks to each and every one of you for making Swan Song a reality. We have about 14 pages left to color and about 24 left to letter, then it's off to the printer!
We will keep you informed!
We appreciate your support,

updates.update_userinfo: Scissor Sisters: Swan Song PDF Link Inside!
updates.update_content:
Oops! Sorry for sending the update on the wrong campaign!
With just over one day left, Swan Song is just over $500 from being fully funded!
Thanks for your support! Please continue to share the link!

We still have a couple of days left to cross the remaining 28% of funds needed to print and distribute Scissor Sisters: Swan Song. Our path to realizing this book has been slowed by family illness and interference from multiple hurricanes, but we are resolute in our desire to see this story in front of your eyes!
Thank you for your support throughout this effort! We still need your help.
Please tell your friends and comics-loving acquaintances about Scissor Sisters: Swan Song and why you chose to support it. Share the link via your social media and email it to friends:

updates.update_content:
Ladies and Gentlemen,
It is with great sadness that we must report...the indie Comic Card kickstarter campaign has been cancelled.  Unfortunately, we bit off more than we can chew and once we develop a better plan to execute such a huge endeavor, we will re-evaluate.
We apologize for any inconvenience and hope you understand.
The IndieComicCards Crew

Wow!  Almost half way funded in the first 24 hours...how amazing is that!?! And with 58 more days in the campaign, there's no reason why we can't not only get funded, but hit both stretch goals.  
If you didn't hear the buzz...today we decided to increase the size of the card set from 100 to 200.  Why?  We want the Indie Comic Book Creator Community to be represented in best possible way and we just couldn't do it with only 100 cards!  Just think how horrible it would be to turn away the additional 100 indie creators.  We couldn't do it!

project_data.project_name: Trading Card Set of Today's Best Indie Comic Book Characters (Canceled)

campaign.story:
Many have tried but none have brought forth an Indie universe just as massive and vibrant as any of the big three! Comprised of indie market greats, legends, and up-and-comers, THE POWERVERSE™ hopes we have done just that! 
SOMETHING LIKE A NEW IMAGE?
Yes, with your help, THE POWERVERSE™ may prove to be that and more! With a respectable line-up of books and both old and new Indy-Characters, THE POWERVERSE™, or TPV for short, hopes to pack a punch that leaves a mark!
THE PREMISE:
Centered around the events that took place in issue #1 of Vince White’s: “THE LEGEND OF WILL POWER”, the indie-comic-multiverse is now dimensionally porous! Because of this, the multi-verse finds itself closer than ever before. THE POWERVERSE™ kicks off officially in THE LEGEND OF WILL POWER issue #8 which has now changed its name to "THE POWERS THAT BE!" 
THE STORY:
In its debuting, five-issue, story-arc, labeled: “THE COMBINATION EFFECT!”, heroes from around the Indy market have to come together to defeat a greater foe. The after effects leave a porous multi-verse the likes of which you’ve never seen! THIS IS THE POWERVERSE™! WHO’S IN? GOOD QUESTION: Key creative teams in this crossover, slash, new cosmography includes: 
 
THE FUTURE:
THE POWERVERSE™ has a number of titles slated for release this year and beyond! The title list thus far includes: THE POWERS THAT BE!, THE GLOBALIST, LIBERTY AND JUSTICE FOR ALL, ROBO1 Defender of Earth, DYNAMO AZAAN, BLACK OUT, and THE ACTION PACK! to name a few! If this isn’t enough to make your mouth water, TPV has plans to sign classic indie creators and revamp some of their classic independent I.P.s going as far back as the 1990’s.
Visit Our Website For More: willpowercomic.com
WHAT IT LOOKS LIKE!

Crafted by the pencils and inks of VINCE WHITE, colors by TOMMY SHELTON and WARNIA K SAHADEWA, the artwork blends a multitude of characters together seamlessly into an enjoyable and interesting read!
Vince White's pencils and inks give balance to the project, never too over the top yet never lacking energy! It's very easy on the eye!
  Justin Cristelli's MARTHA BROWN and Jay Kelley's THE BROTHER push Brian Mark Williams' LUCIUS HAMMER.
  Jay Piscopo's SEA GHOST assists Justin Cristelli's RED KNIGHT
  A mysterious man and Andre Batt's DREADLOCKS look at a list of heroes from the multiverse.
  PLAY

    52 Playable/Collectable RPG Powerverse™ characters card game!
      "FEEL THE POWER!" PACK Be the first to see THE POWERVERSE™ take shape with a PDF Digital copy of "THE POWERS THAT BE!" Issue #1
  "I HAVE THE POWER!" PACK Touch it! Feel it! and Seal it away! Get your very own Kickstarter Limited Edition, Issue #1, Printed Copy of "THE POWERS THAT BE!"
  "THE POWER'S ON THE WALL!" PACK GET THE POSTER AND LEARN THEIR POWERS! This pack includes the limited edition, collector's item POWERVERSE ensemble poster, and the 101 POWERS & PRINCIPLES Special edition Sourcebook!
    "MAN, DO I LOOK POWERFUL!" PACK Represent the Indie's Most Powerful heroes coming together in this High-End, Double sided, A high End POWERVERSE™ Line-up Tee.
  "I'M PLAYING WITH POWER!" PACK PLAY THE GAME! Have fun with friends and family with this sleek, high quality, collectable RPG POWERVERSE™ card game.
  "YOUR CHARACTER IS POWERFUL TOO!" PACK Become one of the creators and have YOUR CHARACTER cameo in issue #1
  "I AM POWER CRAZY!" PACK We're in your BED! Not just a Fan! You're one of Us! We invite you in! Discuss future storylines behind the scenes with PV Creators. And then go to bed thinking of all the possibilities while you're wrapped in PV covers!
  Pledge $5 or more today! Every bit keep the Movement energized!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The book is done! It's being lettered as we speak! The pricing is pretty fare so most of the money is literally going to the rewards. The only foreseeable issue is the cards my not come boxed but shrink-wrapped. This is mainly due to price points and if enough pledges select the playing cards reward. Other than that, we are golden!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
15 YEARS AGO I WENT TO BALTIMORE COMICON AND DECIDED TO BE AN INDEPENDENT COMIC CREATOR AND PUBLISHER...
It was October of 2002.  I had been making comic book characters and stories for fun since the late 80's.  I was 26 years of age and decided to turn pro as much as a 8 dollar an hour job would allow me to do.  So I had spent the previous 6 years compiling art for a comic book and learning how they were made.  I had a large color printer and a little know how of how to print a zine.  I hand printed about 100 copies of what was at the time: THE REPTILE AND MISTER AMAZING: THE ORIGIN and set out to Baltimore Comicon with said copies, my portfolio and a set of Sharpies, and tried to peddle myself as some fancy-shmancy comic artist and writer.  I sold about 2 dozen copies that weekend and caught the comic book bug.  It was one of the best feelings I ever had in my life and I wanted more.
From there I went on to do a pro job on the Reptile comic, and created and produced several other self-published titles, such as: THE PARANORMALS (2003-2008), THE PISTOLEERS (2008-2010), ADAM AND EVE: BIZARRE LOVE TRIANGLE IN THE ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE (2011-2012) and IMPOSSIBLE SPACE TALES OF THE LAST PIT STOP (2012-2017).  Its been a thrill and a privilege to call this my profession and trade over the last 15 years.  I wanted to compile the efforts of that time into one affordable sketchbook and mini-compendium, so that longtime fans can enjoy some awesome new artwork and factoids of their favorite stories and characters of mine.  While uninitiated readers will have a primer to get themselves antiquated with the SANDSHARK UNIVERSE!  
SO WHAT IS THIS SKETCHBOOK ALL ABOUT!
The SKETCHBOOK AND ILLUSTRATED HISTORY will cover all my previous creative efforts under the 21st Century Sandshark Studios banner, including:
THE REPTILE AND MISTER AMAZING
THE PARANORMALS
THE PISTOLEERS
ADAM AND EVE: BIZARRE LOVE TRIANGLE IN THE ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE
IMPOSSIBLE SPACE TALES OF THE LAST PIT STOP
Each segment will have new art along with character and story synopsis, as well as behind the scenes production notes.  Basically its a sketchbook and illustrated guide covering my 15 years of self published projects in a 28 page primer!
On top of all our past glories, we will be focusing on  future endeavors such as our upcoming SPACE TALES TPB, and CHICKEN: USDA REJECTED projects!  
Not to mention this will be 21CSS's first FULL COLOR PROJECT!
Also included all copies will sport a BLANK SKETCH COVER for those of you who are familiar with my efforts as a sketchcover artist.  Here is your chance to get a quick sketch or full commission piece with your very own individualized art cover piece!
SO WHAT'S IN THIS FOR ME IF I BECOME A BACKER?
First off!  We will have a myriad of rewards as we always do for our Kickstarter projects.  Rewards such as:
-SIGNED AND QUICK SKETCHED COPIES OF THE SKETCH COMIC!
-MINI PRINT SETS!
-FULL SIZED 11X17 PRINTS!
-SKETCHCARDS!
-SPECIAL SKETCHCOVER FULL COLOR PIECES ON YOUR COMIC
-9x12 and 11x17 ORIGINAL ART PIECES!
-PRODUCTION ART!
- SPECIAL COMIC STORE BUNDLE DEALS
On top of that we will have stretch goals laid out if we get above and beyond our very modest $750 goal.  They include
$1000
BOOK GOES FROM 28 TO 32 PAGES!  ALL BACKERS WHO PLEDGED AT LEAST $19 GET A BONUS MINI PRINT!
$1500  
 BOOK GOES FROM 32 TO 40 PAGES!  ALL BACKERS WHO PLEDGE AT LEAST $19 GET A 6 PACK BUNDLE OF BONUS MINIPRINTS!   
$2000
BOOK GETS UPPED TO 48 PAGES!   ALL BACKERS WHO PLEDGED AT LEAST $19 GET A SET OF 6 MINI PRINTS AND TWO 8X10 PRINTS!
I think that about covers it!  So what are you waiting for?  Click that BECOME A BACKER button!  Join the 21CSS FANARMY!  SUPPORT THE ALMIGHTY 21 SANDSHARK!  Revisit all the best old memories and salute the promise of whole new ones with the SANDSHARK UNIVERSE SKETCHBOOK AND ILLUSTRATED HISTORY!
Dan Nokes
Creative Director
21st Century Sandshark Studios
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We are setting a May release date for this little project. We intend to get start distributing all our backers their rewards roughly about this point. There is a substantial (About 10-20 pages) of new art production involved. So while much smaller than our usual fare. The completion of them and implementing of said art into the book is our biggest challenge. But I feel pretty confident with 15 years of production experience that I can churn out some nifty looking sketch comics to kick this anniversary celebration off with a bang!

updates.update_content:
Hey folks!  This is Dan Nokes from 21st Century Sandshark Studios!  How is everyone!
I am writing to first appologize for my tardiness in getting rewards out.  Now I can tell you it was because I have been bogged down in two work for hire projects, commission work, my work for VA Comicon, con and show stuff, and Popcomiganza 2.  But they are in the end are just excuses and I am very sorry about the delay.  Ive begun to start making up for it by sending out the PDF stuff to the backers who pledged at that level, because...well, that's the easiest first step to get the ball rolling.  Again thank you for your patience backers and I am now on getting the rest of it out to you.

Hey all!  We are about to close in on the end of this little Kickstarter project!  We have so far met our target goal and even smashed through the first stretch goal!  BUT!  There are still two stretch goals open that I would love to smash through and make happen!  Remember that if we make our goals.  Not only will the sketchbook increase in page length. BUT!  All backers pledging at $19 and above will get extra rewards!  So please become a backer, increase your pledge or help get the word out!  Thanks again for your support and here is shooting for the sky!

Hello all!  This is the leader of the Southern Maryland DIY revolution: Dan Nokes with a message about the 15th ANNIVERSARY KICKSTARTER!  First we currently stand at 34 backers who have pledged $1130 so far!  This means not only will the book be funded and published.  But we also reached our first stretch goal of $1000!  This means the book is now 32 pages and all backers who pledged at least $19 will recieve a bonus mini print!
  We are down to two stretch goals in our last 3 days or so.  Now Stretch goal 2 will consist of the book going up to 40 pages and all backers who pledged $19 get a set of 6 miniprints!  Tier 3 consists of all backers at the $19 level getting all 6 minis PLUS 2 8X10 prints as well!  Not to mention the book then goes up to a WHOPPING 48 PAGES!!!

updates.update_userinfo: GROUND CONTROL: INITIAL TARGET GOAL ACHIEVED!
ALL OF THE STRETCH GOAL MINI PRINTS DONE!!!
updates.update_content:
Hey everybody!  Just like to give you guys and gals a view of the finished miniprints that I will be offering as stretch goals for the $1000 and $1500 levels!  We are still about $250 away from our initial goal of $750.  I am hoping that line gets crossed soon and we can be talking about awesome stretch goals such as these!  Till then, here is a preview of the awesome that you may be getting with your pledge!  Again my thanks to all and here's hoping we hit and hit hard!  
Dan Nokes

Hello all!  
Dan Nokes here!  Just writing to show off the first of 6 miniprint designs, that if we hit our stretch goals.  We will be distributing to all our backers who pledged at least $19!  This is Garth The Robot from THE PARANORMALS!  More soon to be arriving and previewed!  Onward and upward!

Hey folks!  Dan Nokes here with my first official progress report for the SANDSHARK UNIVERSE 15th ANNIVERSARY SKETCHBOOK AND ILLUSTRATED HISTORY Kickstarter!
At the moment we are 5 days in with 18 backers on board!  Our initial goal is very meager with $750 with only $217 needed to close that first gap!
Let me first start off by saying thank you to all those early adopters both long time fans and first time visitors to the almighty 21CSS line of comics!  This means a big deal to me considering that this represents not only a huge chunk of my professional work.  But an opportunity to reach out to new fans out there and let them know where I come from and where I am going.

campaign.story:
Earth Alliance is a 100 plus page full color graphic novel about war, politics and family dynamics.
The Story......
The year is 2190. The human race is thriving, but only after it looked to the stars in search of a replacement for earths depleted fossil fuels. Humans found an energy source , a mineral called elirium, in a distant star system. While mining elirium, mankind made first contact with the Khutarri, a humanoid alien race who also depend on elirium to survive. Both species staked claim to planets that house this indispensable mineral, which has kept them on the brink of intergalactic war for a decade. Neither  humans nor the Khutarri want the fight to extend to their home worlds, but each will do whatever it takes to avoid extinction. In the future, elirium is power. elirium means survival

updates.update_content:
Hello and many thanks to those of you that have sacrificed by serving in the military.
Thanks to all of you for your support, with just under two weeks into the campaign things are slower that expected and it seems that we have hit a lull. If you know anyone that would like to support, could you please spread the word.
Last week I had the great pleasure of being interviewed by Arthur Bellfield on his Artificial Nerds Podcast. I have done many Podcast to discuss my work in comics but I have to say this one is by far my favorite. Arthur is a wonderful interviewer and his questions are excellent.

Hello Folks,
Join me toinght at 7pm est for a facebook live chat, during the chat you will be able to hear more about Future Earth Entertainment and Earth Alliance and ask questions in real time.  Here is the link.  https://live.kickstarter.com/future-earth-entertainment/live/earth-alliance-by-future-earth-entertainment 
https://live.kickstarter.com/future-earth-entertainment/live/earth-alliance-by-future-earth-entertainment

Hello All,
Just wanted to say thanks to you all for your support, and special thanks to those backers that have decided to join the fun again. You know who you are.  I can't tell you how much Earth Alliance means to me, the story has been in my brain for many years so to see it come to life is exciting, and you are a big part in that reality.
The campaign is going well and I'm very optimistic we will hit our goal. If you know of anyone that might like to be apart of this please share the campaign. Sharing on social media is a great way to expose the campaign.
Save
